For 14 years Andrea B. and her husband have sold home-cooked food and meat, although at a very low price. The business is called 'Carnitas Juan'. The couple lives alone now that their children are grown up and look after themselves. They require a loan to buy products for the business so that they are prepared and don't lack anything to continue working at their stall.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for their business

loans.name: Arely Vanessa

texts.es:
La  señora Arely Vanessa M. R., labora como colectora de ruta en el mercado de Mayoreo de Managua, ha trabajado con Ceprodel durante cuatro años y en ese lapso ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de su vivida con los  créditos que ha trabajado con Ceprodel.

El crédito solicitado es para la reparación de su carro ya que actualmente lo tiene en mal estado.

Arely dijo que gracias a los prestamos otorgados por ceprodel ha podido salir adelante.
texts.en:
Mrs. Arely Vanessa M. R. earns her living as a route collector at Managua’s wholesale market. She has worked with Ceprodel for four years and in that time she has been able to make improvements in her life thanks to the loans she has received from Ceprodel. The loan will be used to fix her car as it is not in good condition. Arely states that she has been able to get ahead thanks to the loans she has received from Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make repairs to her car.

loans.name: Jose Sergio

texts.es:
El Sr. JOSE vive en la zona norte de nuestra ciudad en la calle Calama, vive en la casa de su suegra quien no vive en el  país, vive en compañía de su esposa quien es ama de casa, no tienen hijos dependientes, el Señor Jose trabaja 12 horas al día y tiene en sus planes llegar a comprar otro vehiculo mas adelante.Existe una relacion muy bonita entre El Sr. Jose y su esposa ya que siempre estan juntos, siempre coordinan la hora del almuerzo para ir a comer juntos en un restaurant donde están pensionados, a medida de sus posibilidades ellos tratan de comprar algún tipo de bien para su hogar, como por ejemplo actualizan su computadora, compran un microondas, invierten en algún mueble para el hogar o algunas cosas por el estilo, esperemos que sigan mostrando la resposabilidad que muestran en sus pagos. Uno de sus deseos es poder tener una casa propia.

El Sr. Jose esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito
texts.en:
JOSE lvies in the northern part of our city on Calama street. He lives in his mother-in-law's house; she does not live in the country. He lives with his wife, who is a housewife; they have no dependent children. José works a twelve hour day and plans to buy a second vehicle later on. There is a very beautiful relationship between José and his wife; they are always together, they coordinate their schedules so that they can have lunch together at a restaurant where they board. As their means allow, they purchase some asset for their home. For example: they updated their computer, bought a microwave oven, invested in a piece of furniture or some such thing. We hope they will continue to show the responsibility they have so far with respect to repayments. One of their wishes is to have their own home. José is very grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust placed in him by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shock absorbers.

loans.name: Rosie's Group

texts.en:
Rosie P. is 35 years old and she is from the town of Gomez, San Isidro. She is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Rosie P..

Rosie is married and has 6 school-aged children. She owns and operates a business venture providing manicure and pedicure services in the local community. Rosie has been involved in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from this activity.

In 2009, Rosie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Rosie is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda T., 58, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Amado T., an artist, they are blessed with four children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been doing direct selling of cosmetics and clothing of the popular brands for quite some time now.

Esmeralda has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow three times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrowed to expand and improve her business.     

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 8,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying advance orders on her cosmetics and clothing direct selling lines.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow and that she will have more patrons who will continue to be loyal to her and her business.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy orders for cosmetics and clothing

loans.name: Marchie

texts.en:
Marchie J. is from the village of P-3 Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 27 years old. Marchie is single. To make a living, Marchie operates a family member's business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Marchie has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marchie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. This is the first loan of Marchie from GDMPC. Marchie is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marchie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a trader. She sells groceries, drinks and food items to make life meaningful for her and her family in Lagos. She has been in the business for some years and she likes the business because it gives her the opportunity to interact with her customers. 

Florence's business plan is to buy her goods in a large quantities so that she can sell in wholesale and increase her profit. She hopes for loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more groceries, drinks and food to sell.

She is married and has 5 children: three males and 2 females. She is 44 years old and her husband is a civil servant. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries, drinks and food to sell.

loans.name: Maria Matilde

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “CRISTO MORENO”; Nuestra socia vive en la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. MATILDE, ella tiene 35 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos de 12 y 8  de edad, nuestra socia se dedica a la administración de sus propia discoteca ella tiene una discoteca en la av. La cultura llamada la choza, ella trabaja directamente en su negocio para ver la productividad y la calidad del servicio, Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para incrementar su capital de trabajo.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Matilde is a member of the communal lending group “Cristo Moreno”, and lives in Cusco. She is 35, married and has two children aged 12 and 8 years. Matilde manages her own discoteque, called "La Choza" which is located on La Cultura Avenue. By working directly to grow her business in productivity and services, she seeks a loan to increase her operating capital. Mrs. Matilde is grateful for the support offered through micro-lending and is committed to paying the loan off according to the established terms and timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Cassetta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: loan to increase operating capital

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
Lorenza es socia del Banco Comunal Arrieros.
Lorenza es conviviente, tiene 42 años y 5 hijos, Lorenza viaja a las diferentes ferias de la region 4 veces por semana, en donde vende ropa, además Lorenza se dedica a la compra y venta de animales.
Lorenza necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de faldas, pantalones.
Lorenza sueña con que sus hijos culminen sus estudios y salir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en:
Lorenza is a member of the communal bank Arrieros. She is 42, lives with her partner and has 5 children. Lorenza travels to different regional markets 4 times a week, where she sells clothes. She also buys and sells animals. Lorenza requires a loan of 1000 soles to invest in the purchase of skirts and pants. Lorenza dreams about the day her children finish their studies, and in improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase skirts and pants

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth G. is from the village of Brgy.San Nicolas,Bayombong,Nueva Vizcaya. She is 53 years old. Elizabeth is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Elizabeth owns and operates a business making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for more than 15 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elizabeth joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Elizabeth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Antonio Marciano

texts.es: El Sr. Antonio Marciano Y. C. de 42 años de edad vive con su esposa y su hijo. Tiene casa propia, la cual se encuentra ubicada en la Venta Alta distrito de Santiago. Trabaja como obrero de campo en el fundo San Fernando S.A. Su esposa tambien es obrera de campo. El Sr. Antonio es una persona muy emprendedora, que gracías a su empeño y dedicación a logrado salir adelante y poder construir parte de su vivienda. El Sr Antonio requiere el crédito para poder terminar de construir su casa. Su sueño, según nos comenta es terminar de construir dicha vivienda, para poder tener una mejor calidad de vida. El Sr. Antonio esta muy agradecido por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Mr. Antonio Marciano Y. C. is 42 years old, and he lives with his wife and their son. He is the owner of his house, located in La Venta Alta, in the Santiago district. He works as a farm labourer in the San Fernando S.A. estate, and his wife is a farm labourer as well. Antonio is a very enterprising person who, thanks to his commitment and dedication has succeeded in getting by and in building part of his house. Antonio is requesting a loan in order to finish building his house. He told us that his dream is to finish constructions on his house to reach a better quality of life. Antonio is really thankful for the help we can offer through this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish building his house.

loans.name: Favor Group

texts.en:
Rachel C., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Favor. She is 33 years old, is married, and has seven children who range from 4 to 16 years old. She also cares for one sibling. Rachel was only able to attend school through 7th grade due to lack of financial support.

For 14 years, Rachel has been selling frozen meat, such as chicken and pork, in West Point community, Monrovia, Liberia.

Rachel plans to use her 11,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 55,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more frozen chicken and pork to sell. She describes herself as moderate.

Rachel’s goal is to improve her business and continue to support her children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy more frozen chicken and pork to sell

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria B. is from the village of Bangko, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Candelaria owns & operates a specialized retail store where she sells daily use products such as sardines, milo, cocoa, biscuits, shampoo, soap & toothpaste. Candelaria has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Candelaria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to provide additional capital for her business. Candelaria is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Candelaria from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai S. is 45 years old, married, and devoted to her child, who is already married and lives at home. She is married to 50-year-old Chounvinh, who helps support the family by working in the construction field. Mai S. owns a small business selling fruit to villagers as a means of income.
The family is often affected by transport problems as it has no vehicle. Therefore, Mai S. has decided to seek a loan of $600 USD in order to purchase a used motorcycle to provide transport for the family.

loans.use: To purchase a used motorcycle to provide family transport

loans.name: Olga Cristina

texts.es:
Olga de 59 años, ella tiene un local de venta de pescados, vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil, tiene dos hijos ya mayores de edad que le ayudan en el negocio. 

Ella empezó vendiendo encebollados (plato típico del Ecuador, llena pescados, cebolla) en una carreta recorriendo las calles de las Orquídeas, poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo alquilar un local para su negocio. Ahora ella trabaja vendiendo encebollados desde las 07h00am hasta las 18h00pm todos los días. 

Ella quiere comprar con el préstamo pescados y cebollas para hacer mas encebollado en su negocio, en el futuro quiere tener otro local  y tener empleados fijos.
texts.en:
Olga, 59, sells fish. She lives in Las Orquídeas, Guayaquil. She has two adult children that help her with the business. She started out selling “encebollados” from a cart along Orquídeas’s streets. (The base of this seafood soup is called “sofrito” and is a pungent mix of tomatoes, onions, cumin, chili and cilantro. The protein element and foundation for the stock is tuna. The starch element is yuca a starchy root vegetable that requires time to cook down the coarse threads found within its stalk. The result is a delicious aromatic savory and spicy soup that is traditionally topped with pickled onions and tomatoes.) Gradually, with much effort, she was able to rent a locale for her business. She is now open for business selling encebollados from 7am until 6pm every day. She wants to use the loan to buy fish and onions to make more encebollados and in the future would like to have a second locale and to have permanent employees.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish and onions.

loans.name: Trabajando Para El Futuro 2 & 9 Group

texts.en:
Eladia is the coordinator of her group Trabajando para el Futuro 2 & 9. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and 3 children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to have her own house built with concrete blocks. In the meantime she plans to continue to enjoy her current home.

Eladia is excited to be taking her 10th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She has had her business for more than 6 years after she started selling at home, while her husband was fishing. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying all kinds of seafood (octopus, fish, squid, etc). She will use the profits from her business to buy school supplies. She also needs to buy a dining table and and a vehicle to transport the merchandise.

This Esperanza associate began with us because she needed the loans for her business. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Samana, a lush rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy seafood

loans.name: Samuel Mwangi

texts.en:
Samuel Mwangi K. is 42 years old, married to Priscah Wanjiku and has four children who attend school.

Samuel started commercial farming last year. He was introduced to KADET by his friend. This will be his first loan. He plans to use the cash to plow his farm, buy maize seedlings and plant them.

Samuel is hoping to expand his farm and also to open a grocery shop in the future.

loans.use: To plow his farm and buy maize seedlings

loans.name: Oyun

texts.en:
Mrs. Oyun D. is 49 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Oyun and her husband, Lkhasuren, have been running a furniture-making business since 1998. They have managed to send the elder daughter to Korea to study. Their son is a sculpture who works on a freelance basis and also helps with the parents’ business. The younger daughter studies at the local University of Agriculture.

Oyun and her husband buy materials such as plywood, HDF board, glue and fabric from local wholesalers and make different household furniture for apartments and gers (a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent). They sell them at Narantuul and Denjiin myanga, the two biggest outdoor markets in Ulaanbaatar.

Since Oyun and her husband started their business, they managed to buy a family house with a plot of land. Currently they are doing some renovation to the house. The loan they are requesting will be used to renovate the house and to increase their working capital and inventory.

loans.use: To renovate their house and increase their working capital and inventory

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San S., 42, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia: an area known for palm products. S. sells groceries, earning an income of about USD 2.5 per day. Her husband is a taxi driver, earning an income of about 3 per day. The family has to spend USD 44 on food, USD 8 on electricity and water supplies, and USD 15 on other necessary expenses every month.  

S. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. 

S.'s husband appears in the photograph because S. is not available.

loans.use: to buy more groceries and goods to sell

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is a very supportive lady. She is involved in an embroidery business. She does this work to support her family financially. She comes from a mid-sized city, Kasur, which is known in Pakistan for its leather industry. She owns a 2-room brick house in an area named Basti Shahdra and has been living in it with her family for over 20 years. She is married to G. N. who works in a factory for a meager income. 

Razia has given birth to two daughters. Her elder daughter has completed her 10th class and now she helps Razia in completing her embroidery orders. Her younger daughter is 8 years of age and studies in a local school. 

Razia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her embroidery business. With the loan, she will buy embroidery items such as clothes, beads, colored thread and sketches in bulk quantity to fill larger orders on time. This loan investment will help her in making more money and to improve the financial condition of her family. 

She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and hopes it will have a positive impact on her business. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) in her hands is Razia.

loans.use: To buy embroidery items for embroidery business

loans.name: Inocencio

texts.en:
Inocencio Z. is from the village of Brgy. Cutar, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 26 years old and single. To make a living, Inocencio owns and operates a business raising livestock. His main source of income comes primarily from raising pigs for breeding. Inocencio has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. 

Inocencio joined ASKI in 2009 to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase breeding livestock. Inocencio is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Inocencio from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated by the loan to improve and expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Jorge Ruben

texts.es:
El señor  Jorge Ruben J. S. tiene 42 años de edad y vive en una casa de propia vivienda que esta ubicada en la comunidad de Santa Ana de la ciudad de Tarija. Jorge es casado con la señora Marina Janeth Altamirano Sandoval con quien tiene 2 hijos.  Jorge se dedica al servicio de profesor del area rural y en sus horas libres se dedica al transporte libre de pasajeros como taxista ambas actividades las viene desarrollando desde hace mas de 20 años.  El cuenta con extensiones de terreno donde tiene ganado y además siembra papa.

Francisco necesita  comprar semillas de papa para sembrar, de esa forma mejorar sus ingresos para brindarles una mejor vida a su esposa e hijos, es por eso que el crédito será destinado para la compra de dichas semillas.
                                                                                                                                                                                                       
Jorge nos cuenta que quiere darle a su esposa e hijos toda la comodidad que pueda, por eso nos dice que el proximo credito que solicite sera para mejorar las condiciones de su casa donde vive.
texts.en:
Mr. Jorge Ruben J. S. is 42 years old. He lives in a house that he owns in the Santa Ana community in the city of Tarija. Jorge is married to Mrs. Marina Janeth Altamirano. They have 2 children. Jorge works as a rural area teacher. In his off hours he works as an independent taxi driver transporting passengers. He has been carrying out both of these activities for more than 20 years. He owns plots of land where he has cattle and also plants potatoes.

Jorge needs to buy potato seeds for planting. This way he will improve his income to offer a better life for his wife and children. This is why the loan will go towards purchasing these seeds.
                                                                                                                                                                                                       
Jorge tells us that he wants to provide his wife and children with every comfort that he can. For this reason he informs us that the next loan he requests will be for improving the condition of the house where he lives.

loans.use: Purchase of potato seed for planting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy ingredients for making her tortillas

loans.name: Nuraly

texts.en:
Nuraly U. is 30 years old and married with three sons. He was born in the Batken region, in the south of Kyrgyzstan in a farm-worker’s family. From early childhood, he helped his parents in farming. After finishing school, he started to engage in land cultivating, but it was not very profitable because of the deficiency of cropland. 

In 2002, in order to find better place to live, Nuraly decided to move to the Chui region in the north of the country. Gaining a wide experience in raising livestock, Nuraly started his business in cattle breeding, which became the main source of income for his family. With initial capital of 10,000 Kyrgyzstan soms (KGS), he managed to earn about 12,000 KGS monthly.  Due to his strong efforts, Nuraly has established his farm and today it has two bull calves and still needs to be developed.  

Nuraly plans to use the loan of 80,000 KGS to broaden his business through buying three bull calves. With the revenues from the loan, he plans to broaden his business by purchasing more cattle.

Nuraly is doing his best to provide good conditions for his children. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Francis Janethe

texts.es:
La señora Francis Janethe P. Zúniga es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien vende ropa interior, cosméticos desde hace diez años  y hace dos año inicio con  un pequeño kiosco en un colegio.  Ella tiene siete años de trabajar con Adim en los cuales su negocios han ido creciendo y desarrollando.

P. de 37 años madre de tres hijos de 22, 14 y 10 años invertirá el crédito en ropa interios (blúmer, hilos, bikinis, brasier, fajas etc. y en productos para el kiosko ya que se acerca el regreso a clases.
texts.en:
Francis Janethe P. Zúniga is a hardworking woman, motivated and entrepreneurial. She has been selling undergarments and cosmetics for 10 years. Two years ago she opend up a small stand at a school. She has been working with Kiva partner Adim for sevenn years, during which time her businesses have been growing and developing.

She is 37 years old and the mother of three children, who are 22, 14, and 10 years old. She will invest this loan in undergarments (bloomers, thongs, bikinis, bras, girdles, etc.) as well as in merchandise for the stand since it is nearing the time when school will be back in session.

loans.use: Clothes and merchandise for the stand

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Quiroga se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Quiroga de la  ciudad de Calceta, localidad donde la gente se dedica en gran parte a la agricultura, cría de animales  y a la venta de sus productos.

La señora Ángela  tiene 61 años de edad, hace varios años quedo viuda y tiene 7 hijos todos mayores de edad pero dos de sus hijas que están solteras aun viven con ella, hace varios  estudió  repostería y pastelería en la Universidad Técnica de Manabí donde obtuvo su título. Está en el banco comunal hace ya diez años y le gusta porque siempre están atentos a las necesidades de los socios.

Tiene un local donde ella elabora y vende los más deliciosos bocadillos y pasteles de toda la zona nos afirma ella muy orgullosa de lo que hace porque dice que todo lo que hace lo realiza con amor, prepara bufet para fiestas y para cualquier compromiso,  también los fines de semana prepara y vende comida. Trabaja todos los días en las tardes y los fines de semana todo el día, a veces le ayudan sus dos hijas cuando llegan de sus estudios.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar  materiales  para la elaboración de los bocadillos que solo se consiguen en Quito. Sus metas son tener un negocio más industrializado para llevar sus productos a otras ciudades.
texts.en:
El Banco Comunal Quiroga meets every fifteen days in the Quiroga neighbourhood in the city of Calceta, an area where people work mostly in agriculture, raising animals and selling what they produce.

Ángela is 61 years old and has been a widow for several years.  She has seven children, all of them grown, however two of her daughters who are single still live with her.  Some years ago, she studied pastry making at the Technical University of Manabí, where she got her professional qualifications.  She has been a part of the Banco Comunal for ten years and likes it because they always consider the needs of the members.

Ángela has a premises where she makes and sells the most delicious savory and sweet pastries and hors d'oeuvres of the whole area, and she tells us she is very proud of her work because she says that everything she does, she does with love.  She prepares buffets for parties and for any engagement; also on weekends she prepares and sells food. She works daily in the afternoons, and on weekends all day long.  At times her two daughters help when they return home from their studies.

This loan will be used in the purchase of materials for preparing pastries that are only available in Quito.  Her goal is to have a more industrialized business in order to bring her products to other cities.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for the preparation of pastries.

loans.name: Geofrey Omondi

texts.en:
Geoffrey A. is a 25-year-old, enterprising man from Kisumu, a city along the shores of Lake Victoria. He is married to Janet who sells vegetables. They have two children aged two and four years.

Geoffrey operates a motorcycle transport business in Kisumu (a business locally known as Boda Boda). This form of transport is becoming popular in many rural areas of Kenya since it is cheap and convenient. Kennedy is taking a first asset loan from KADET Limited to buy another motorcycle. He plans to pay back this loan well so that he can qualify for more loans in the future. 

Geoffrey will use the profits to pay for the loan and also to save so that he can buy another motorcycle: his long term plan is to own a transport business (taxi company) that can support his family in terms of their basic needs.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Sandra Lorena

texts.es:
Sandra es pequeña comerciante desde hace veinte cuatro años, iniciando con poca mercadería, lo que viene aumentar sus ventas atreves de préstamo que Afodenic otorga, lo que vende es prendas de plata, carne, refrescos, gaseosas, en donde ha contado con el apoyo de su esposo para la formación de sus cuatro hijos.
Con sus préstamos ha logrado las mejoras a su casa, hoy con este nuevo financiamiento pondrá cielo raso y embaldosar parte del patio en la parte de atrás. En donde comprara: arena, cemento, esponjas, láminas de playsem para el cielo raso entre otros para hacer la mejora.
texts.en:
Sandra has been a saleswoman for 24 years. She began with little merchandise, and has seen her sales increase thanks to a loan from Afodenic. She sells silver jewelry, meat, and soft drinks, and has been able to depend on her husband's support while raising their four children.

With her loans, she has made improvements to her house, and with this loan, will put up a ceiling and tile part of the back patio. She plans to buy sand, cement, sponges, and boards as well as other supplies to put up the ceiling.

loans.use: Construction materials for a ceiling and to tile part of the patio

loans.name: Yesenia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yesenia de 21 años de edad, reside en Santa María, departamento de Usulután, vive con su esposo, una hija de 2 años y también su madre, todos trabajan, solamente su hija depende económicamente; se dedica a la preparación y venta de tamales, comenzó con la ayuda de su madre, trabaja de forma ambulante y no tiene un horario fijo.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de elotes y leña, esto para preparar los tamales, con esta ayuda contara con lo necesario y fortalecerá el negocio, para seguir generando ingresos a su familia.
Las aspiraciones de Yesenia son crecer con el negocio, mejorar la clientela y vivir más solvente con los gastos e ingresos de la familia.
texts.en:
Yesenia is 21 years old. She lives in Santa María, in the Usulután department, with her husband, their 2-year-old daughter and her mother. The three adults have a job, only her daughter is economically dependent on them. Yesenia engages in preparing and selling tamales, an activity she started with her mother’s help. She is a street vendor and her working hours are flexible.
She is currently requesting a loan to buy maize and firewood to prepare tamales. This loan will help her acquire what she needs and it will strengthen her activity, thus enabling her to keep on earning money for her family.
Yesenia wishes for her activity to keep on growing, she wants to increase the number of her customers and to participate even more in solving the family’s debts and in generating an income for her family.

loans.use: To buy maize and firewood.

loans.name: Tatiana Lorena

texts.es:
En la parroquia Eloy Alfaro de la ciudad de  Manta cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Mujeres Con Esperanza.  Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, es uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América  y está situado a orillas del Océano Pacifico.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Tatiana, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 21, 18, 12 y 9 años de edad, los dos menores son los que aun viven con ella y estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es comerciante de mariscos al por mayor.

Ella también tiene un negocio de venta de mariscos en su casa, vende camarón, pescado de algunas variedades, conchas, langostinos, calamares, ostiones, cangrejos, etc. Ella entrega  los mariscos limpios y a veces también lo hace a domicilio. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00hasta las 11h00, sus productos los compra a su esposo que entrega al por mayor el mismo que le vende a un precio especial. Lleva 18 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien ya que tiene mucha clientela fija.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar camarón, pescado, conchas, ostiones, langostinos, cangrejos, calamares, etc. Este es su sexto ciclo  en el Banco Comunal y le agrada porque los intereses son muy bajos.
 
Su sueño es tener un carro.
texts.en:
In the city of Manta's Eloy Alfaro parish every 15 days, the “Mujeres Con Esperanza” (Women with Hope) Communal Bank meets. The location is known for its beautiful beaches which are visited in all seasons of the year by national and foreign tourists. This is one of the most important ports in the country and of America, and it's located on the shores of the Pacific Ocean.

Here resides Tatiana, who is 37 years old and married, with 4 children from this union, ages 21, 18, 12, and 9. The 2 youngest still live with her and study in school. Her husband is a wholesale seafood merchant.

Tatiana also sells seafood in her home; shrimp, a variety of fish, conch, prawns, squid, oysters, crab, etc. She cleans the seafood and sometimes delivers them to the customer. She works every day from 8:00 until 11:00 am. Tatiana buys her products from her husband who charges her wholesale or a special price. She has been doing this for 18 years, and it is going very well since she has many fixed customers.

This loan will be used to buy shrimp, fish, conch, oysters, prawns, crabs, squid, etc.  Tatiana is in her 6th loan cycle with the Communal Bank and she is grateful because the interest rates are very low. 

Her dream is to own a car.

loans.use: TO BUY SHRIMP, FISH, CONCH, OYSTERS, PRAWNS, CRAB, SQUID, ETC., TO SELL

loans.name: Agueda

texts.es: La señora Agueda tiene un snack donde vende salchipapas. El crédito lo necesita para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de las salchipapas como papa, salchicha, mayonesa, ketchup, mostaza. Es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para mantener  a su familia. Es casada, tiene un  hijo y vive en casa de un familiar  ubicada en la zona de las Achachicala de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la primera vez que obtiene un crédito en IMPRO.
texts.en: Sra. Agueda has a snack bar where she sells “salchipapas” (sausages and fried potatoes). She needs a loan to buy supplies for making this dish such as potatoes, sausages, mayonnaise, ketchup, and mustard. This business is the source of income by which she supports her family. Agueda is married, has one child, and lives in the family home located in the District of Achachicala in the city of La Paz. This is the first loan she has received from IMPRO.

loans.use: To purchase potatoes, sausages, mayonnaise, ketchup, and mustard.

loans.name: Bimala

texts.en:
This is 51 year-old Bimala S..  She is married and has one child, age 6.  In 2005, she established her meat shop business.  Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supoorts her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent one to buy goats and chickens for her business.  

In the future, Bimala plans to improve the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.   In Nepal, the meat is always fresh.  In small stalls along busy roads, open air butcher shops sell chicken, goat, and water buffalo by the kilo.  The stalls are piled high with product and sales are brisk.  

With the help of a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase additional stock at better prices.  This increase in purchasing volume creates greater profit margins for the borrower.  This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  

For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:
 BPW Partner Page     Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team"

loans.use: to buy chickens and goats

loans.name: Luz Did

texts.es:
Debido a la falta de oportunidades laborales, Luz Did de 26 años de edad y oriunda del municipio de El Carmen de Vìboral al oriente de Antioquia decidió crear su propia fuente de empleo, un almacén que ha ido mejorando poco a poco gracias a su tenacidad y ganas de superarse, pues ahora además de obtener sus ingresos genera dos empleos a madres cabeza de hogar, lo que la llena de satisfacción. 

Su gran visión empresarial la ha llevado a soñar con un gran almacén en el que pueda generar muchos más empleos y así aportar al progreso de su comunidad. Por ahora, Luz Did continúa trabajando fuertemente para sacar su negocio adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida. Por ahora necesita de un préstamo para realizar algunas adecuaciones locativas en su negocio.
texts.en:
Due to the lack of employment opportunities, Luz Did decided to create her own source of employment.  She is 26 years old and lives in the town of El Carmen de Viboral to the west of Antioquia.  Her store has been improving little by little thanks to her tenacity and desire to improve.  In addition to the income it generates, it gives jobs to two female heads of households, which fills her with satisfaction.

Her great business vision has lead her to dream of a large store where she can provide many more jobs and contribute to the progress of her community.  For now, Luz Did continues to work hard to improve her business and improve her quality of life.  For now, she needs a loan to make some adjustments to the location of her business.

loans.use: to make adjustments to the location of her business.

loans.name: Mahugnon As Group

texts.fr: MAHUGNON AS est un  groupement composé de vingt personnes qui vivent toutes dans le même quarter au Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, afin d’élever le niveau de leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. La représentante du groupe du nom de Annick est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Annick est née le 19 Mai 1972 au Bénin. Annick est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés et qui vivent ensemble avec elle. Annick ne vit plus avec son mari. Annick supporte seule les charges de ses enfants. Pour y arriver, Annick prépare de la nourriture (pâte de maïs accompagné de poissons frits) qu'elle vend à sa clientèle. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à ainsi subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants. Annick mène cette activité depuis quinze ans et s'approvisionne au Bénin. Ce crédit permettra certainement à Annick et à son groupe de rehausser leur activité et d'accroître leur chiffre d'affaire et leur revenu.
texts.en:
Mahugnon As is a group composed of twenty people who live in the same neighborhood in Benin. This is the second time that the group has sought a loan through ALIDé, in order to raise the level of their business and better respond to their clients' demand. 

The group's representative Annick is the one raising her hand in the photo. Annick was born May 19, 1972 in Benin. She is the mother of two children, both in school and living together with her. She is no longer living with her husband; she alone pays her children's expenses. In order to make a living, Annick prepares food (corn paste accompanied by fried fish) which she sells to her clientele. This business generates income for her, helping her meet her children's needs. Annick has been running this business for fifteen years and gets her supplies in Benin.

This loan will surely allow Annick and her group to improve their businesses and increase their sales and their income.

loans.use: to buy corn, condiments, and fresh fish.

loans.name: Giorgi

texts.en:
Giorgi comes from village Gora, Imereti Region, in the western part of the country. He is 48 years old and a farmer, married and lives with his wife Bella, their 24-year-old son, 20-year-old daughter and his parents. Giorgi’s son works in a local private company as an electrician. Their daughter is temporarily unemployed and assists her parents in farming activities. Giorgi’s parents are retired. 

Giorgi and Bella lead the agricultural business in the family. They have one milk cow, whose milk is used for cheese production. The latter is sold to local dairy product retailers. Also they have a vineyard with 2000 grape vines. Approximately half of the harvested grapes are sold in the village and the other half is used for wine production. Produced wine is sold on the local open market. The total average monthly income of the family is 800 Laris.

Giorgi’s house is old and needs renovation. He requested credit from Credo for purchasing materials for renovation – ceramic tiles for the floor and plaster bars for the walls. After the renovations, the living conditions of the family will improve.

loans.use: to purchase materials for house renovation.

loans.name: Altantuya

texts.en:
Altantuya is 31 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Tuv province of Mongolia. Her older daughter is a student and her younger two, who haven't reached school age, stay home. 

Altantuya's husband is a driver who manages a transportation service business. She manages a dairy product trading business in her town. She started her business in 1999. She herds husbandry animals and produces dairy products like yogurt and milk. Now she has 8 cows in her possession. Her business is quite successful which allowed her to supplement to her family earning. She is a hardworking lady who says, "I am planning to have more livestock in the future." She is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase three cows for her business.

loans.use: to purchase three cows.

loans.name: Essohanam Badagnaki

texts.fr: Revendeuse de charbon de bois depuis 2007 à domicile, Essohanam est mariée à un commerçant et mère  d’un enfant. Elle s’approvisionne à Mango, une localité située au nord du pays. Ce crédit va lui permettre de mieux s’approvisionner  pour répondre aux besoins des consommateurs en quantité souhaité et aider son mari dans l’éducation de leur enfant.
texts.en: Essohanam has sold charcoal out of her home since 2007. She is married to a merchant and is the mother of one child. She gets her supplies in Mango, a village in northern Togo. This loan will enable her to get more supplies in order to have sufficient quantities of charcoal at her disposal to meet the demand of her customers, and to help her husband with the education of their child.

loans.use: to buy charcoal.

loans.name: Saiffullo

texts.en:
Saiffullo is a responsible father of three children. Since 2000 he has been running a business producing iron-metal products such as doors, window lattice and lattice fences. He started his business with his own capital and now he would like to increase his working capital. Saiffullo would like to request a loan of 12,000 TJS for purchasing metal strips, paint and plywood in order to expand his business.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy metal strips, paint and plywood.

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis is married and blessed with one child. He is 46 years of age and already 26 years operating his farming business.  He also manages hog raising as an additional source of income. Each crop season he usually earns P50,000 and saves it for the next planting season. Part of the income also utilized in supplying for their basic necessities. 

Luis is asking a loan amount of P25,000 to pay for the labor of the people who work with him in the farm. Apart from that, he will also buy fertilizers and insecticides for the sustenance of his farming. He is working hard to provide the demands of his child in school and lift his family from poverty.

loans.use: To pay for the labor of the people who work with him in the farm.

loans.name: Salima

texts.en:
Salima is a married woman with six children, four attend school while two are still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

For the past four years, Salima has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge in competition from other retail shop operators. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop and establishing a clothes selling business. 

With the Kshs 40,000, Salima wants to purchase bundles of second-hand clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy second-hand clothes to resell

loans.name: Artur

texts.ru:
Артур родился в 1980 г. в поселке Каварт, где и окончил сельскую среднюю школу. Артур женат, имеет двух сыновей: старшему 7 лет, учится в школе, а младшему 4 года. Жена не работает. Мать Артура живет вместе с ними. Артур работает на Капанской электростанции. 
Параллельно со своей работой на электростанции, Артур занимается сельским хозяйством: он разводит крупный рогатый скот, выращивает овощи и фрукты. А недавно Артур начал разводить кроликов на своей ферме. Выращенные овощи и фрукты, а также говядину и молоко Артур продает своим постоянным клиентам в городе Капане. Жена Артура помогает ему на ферме и таким образом они содержат семью, а также обеспечивают ее свежими и натуральными продуктами со своей фермы.
Кредит на сумму 300,000 драм необходим Артуру для покупки сена для своего крупного рогатого скота. 
Данный кредит Артура является 4-ым по счету и он никогда не задерживал выплат по кредиту.
texts.en: Artur was born in 1980 in the Kavart village, where he also graduated from a secondary school.  Artur is married and has two sons, the oldest of whom is seven years old and the youngest is four years old.  His oldest son goes to school.  Artur's wife does not work.  Artur's mother lives together with them.  Artur works at the Kapan power plant.  Parallel to this work, he is involved in agriculture.  He breeds cattle, grows vegetables and fruits.  Recently Artur began breeding rabbits on his farm.  Artur sells produced vegetables and fruits and also beef and milk to his loyal customers in the city of Kapan.  His wife helps him at the farm, and this is how they support the family and provide it with fresh and natural farm products.  Artur is requesting a loan in the sum of 300,000 dram for the purchase of hay for his cattle.  This would be Artur's fourth loan, and he has never been late repaying his loans.

loans.use: to purchase hay for cattle

loans.name: Real

texts.en:
Real is a farmer working in Kompong Speu Province of Cambodia. She has been growing rice for many years. She is married to Sokhom, who works as junk goods collector and earns about 3 USD each day. Real and her husband have six children. Two of her children are married and live separately, two of her children work in a sewing factory in Phnom Penh where they earn fix salary per month, and the other two children are attending school. 

Real and her husband are requesting a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase more goods to sell, as they lack the money to do this. This is Real's first loan with HKL. She is expecting that this loan will let her family find happiness and prosperity and have a bigger house. Real says that everything she does is for her family’s well-being because she’d like to give them a different lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase junk goods to sell

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina has a small grocery sales business that she operates from a space under a covered pavilion in the busy city market in Kahovka, Ukraine. Valentina is a very experienced market vendor, having been in business over ten years. She works many long hours in a week to make a good income. Her profit for a typical month is about 2,500 Gryvnas, a valuable source of income for her and her husband Alexander. 

Valentina would like to continue the success of her business and has requested a loan of 12,000 Gryvnas to help purchase food inventory to sell. Valentine appreciates the opportunity to receive financial assistance that will help her to make a better life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase food inventory for sale

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KANCHARY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marcelina; ella tiene 47 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de quesos, la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 8.00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de queso. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar quesos al por mayor.    
                                                                                   
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Marcelina belongs to the Kanchary communal bank.  The bank is located in the Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

Marcelina, age 47, is single and has three children.  She alternates her daily activities with the business of selling cheese.  She works from 7:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m.  It is through this business that she gets her children ahead.

She wants to expand her business of selling cheese.  She is requesting the loan to buy cheese wholesale.

She is very happy about the loan, and she pledges to make all of her payments.

loans.use: to buy cheese wholesale.

loans.name: Fégbawe

texts.fr:
Fégbawe est une femme  de 31 ans. Elle est mariée à un contremaître. Elle n’a pas d’enfants. 
Fégbawe gère un pressing depuis 2010. Elle fait l’activité dans son atelier et a une clientèle plutôt diversifiée. 
Fégbawe a requis son premier crédit à WAGES afin d’acheter une nouvelle machine à laver. Elle veut utiliser ses profits supplémentaires pour améliorer le cadre de son activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Fégbawe voudrait ouvrir d’autre pressing. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit d’améliorer les conditions de vie de ses futurs  enfants.
texts.en:
Fégbawe is a 31 year old woman. She is married to a foreman. She doesn't have any children. 
Since 2010, Fégbawe has managed a laundry. She runs her business from her workshop and has a diverse clientèle. 
Fégbawe has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy a new washing machine. She wants to use the additional revenue to improve the standing of her business. 
In the coming years, Fégbawe would like to open another laundry. She says that she wants to use the profits to improve the living conditions of her future children.

loans.use: Buy a washing machine

loans.name: Jora

texts.en: Jora lives in the Shirak region of Armenia in the village of Akhouryan.  He is married with three children – a twenty-one-year-old daughter and two sons (twenty-eight and thirty-five years old).  Jora has a high school education and has worked on the railway system.  Over the past twenty years, he has been working in agriculture on the family farm.  In the past couple of years, Jora has been taking microcredit loans.  He has found the terms fair and the service to be of high quality.  He would like a new loan to purchase pigs and feed.  He projects this investment will increase the family income by fifteen percent.  One of Jora’s long-term projects is to renovate the family home.  He was born in Akhouryan and enjoys the rural life.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and feed

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.es: Anastacia se dedica a ser docente de directora de una escuela, ella es una mujer luchadora que quiere salir adelante. Ella quiere el financiamiento para realizar la compra de materiales de construcción, como cemento, bloques, arena cemento entre otros. Desde hace 6 años que quiere realiza estas mejoras y no había podido construir por falta de dinero. Sueña con terminar de arreglar su vivienda ya que le hacen falta mejoras.
texts.en: Anastacia is a school teacher and principal.  She’s a very hardworking woman who always wants to get ahead.  She wants the loan to buy building materials and supplies like cement, concrete blocks and sand, among others.  She’s wanted to do these improvements for six years but had been unable to do so for lack of money.  She dreams with finishing home improvements because it needs them.

loans.use: to buy cement, concrete blocks and sand, among others.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is married with four dependents, and her husband is a farmer. Aba has been selling "banku" (fermented corn dough) and "wakkye" (beans and rice) at Dompoase for the past five years now. She helps her husband to pay their children’s school fees. Aba will use her loan to buy bulk maize and rice. She will use her new profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bulk maize and rice.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
La señora Elvira tiene 48 años y vive con su esposo Jose y hijos en Los Torres, una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Choloma. La señora tiene 5 hijos de 24, 22, 16, 15, 13 años de edad. Los 3 menores están estudiando. Elvira, su esposo y dos de sus hijos aportan económicamente a los gastos del hogar. 

Hace 3 años, doña Elvira inició su negocio de la elaboración y venta de tortillas. Decidió poner la tortillera porque faltaba una en la zona y debido a su deseo de tener un negocio proprio que le generara ingresos para sostener la familia. Trabaja 6 horas diarias en la elaboración de tortillas. Doña Elvira también vende ropa usada de forma ambulante. 

Solicitó este crédito de L8,000 para la compra de insumos como harina, sal, soda y manteca. Ella espera sacar adelante a sus hijos menores, dándoles lo necesario en la educación.
texts.en:
Sra. Elvira is 48 years old and lives with her husband Jose and their children in Los Torres, a neighborhood in the town of Choloma. Her five children are ages 24, 22, 16, 15, and 13. The three youngest children are studying. Elvira, her husband, and two of her children financially support the household expenses.

Three years ago, Elvira started her business of making and selling tortillas. She decided to establish a tortilla shop because the area lacked this type of business. Elvira also wanted to have her own business so that she could generate income to sustain her family. She works six hours a day making tortillas. Doña Elvira also sells used clothing as a traveling vendor.

She is requesting a loan of 8000 HNL in order to buy supplies such as flour, salt, soda, and lard. Elvira hopes that her young children will succeed and wants to provide them what they need for their education.

loans.use: to buy flour, salt, soda, and lard.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 5 children. 

Violeta has a retail shop where she sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Violeta is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Violeta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Shirley Marisol

texts.es:
La Señora Shirley es socia del banco comunal Mi Bankito, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por la belleza de su centro histórico el cual cuenta el pasado de esta bella ciudad, es bañada por 4 ríos los que le dan el nombre de la Santa Ana de los 4 ríos, su gente es amable y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña Shirley tiene 23 años, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 3 hijos de 5, 3 y 2 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en un taller de carpintería que es de su propiedad, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Ella se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y cuidado de sus hijos, se encuentra en su sexto crédito  que realiza en la banca comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de herramientas para la carpintería de su esposo.

Su meta es terminar sus estudios colegiales.
texts.en:
Sra. Shirley is a member of the Communal Bank “Mi Bankito” (My Little Bank). She lives in the city of Cuenca, which is known for the beauty of its historical center. The city is surrounded by four rivers, thus giving it the nickname “Santa Ana of the Four Rivers”. The people are friendly and have maintained the culture and traditions of their ancestors.

Doña Shirley is 23 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has three children (ages 5, 3, and 2). Her oldest child attends a school in the city. Shirley’s husband works in a carpentry workshop that he owns. They do not own a home, so they live in a rental property.

Shirley takes care of the household chores and looks after her children. She is receiving her sixth loan from the Communal Bank and will invest in the purchase of tools for her husband’s carpentry business. Her goal is to finish her college studies.

loans.use: to buy tools for her husband's carpentry business.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.ru:
Элвире 29 лет, замужем.  Элвира  - актриса музыкально-драматического театра, здесь также музыкантом работает и муж Элвиры. Старший сын этой семьи пошел по стопам родителей и поступил в музыкальное школу-училище в  столице г. Бишкек.  
В качестве дополнительного источника финансирования своей семьи,  Элвира начала бизнес в откорме и перепродаже скота.  Начатое еще в 2006 году с суммы в 8,000 сом (KGS), хозяйство, насчитывающее две коровы и пять баранов, сегодня приносит около 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных продуктов.   Скопив необходимую сумму с прибыли от бизнеса, Элвира с мужем купили музыкальный аппарат для записи. В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Элвира обратилась в компанию «Бай  Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 90,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительного скота. Доходы от кредита Элвира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины, и в ближайшем будущем – отремонтировать дом.
texts.en:
Elvira is 29 years old, and married. She is an actress in the theatre, and where her husband also works as a musician. The family's eldest son followed in the footsteps of his parents and entered music school in the capitol, Bishkek. To augment the family's finances, Elvira started a business in raising and selling livestock. Started in 2006 with a starting capital of 8,000 somi (KGS), the farm, which began with two cows and five sheep, now brings in about 5,000 somi (KGS) a month from the sale of diary products. 

After having saved up the needed amount from the profits from the business, Elvira and her husband purchased some music recording equipment. To further increase her numbers of livestock, Elivra has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan in amount of 90,000 somi (KGS) to purchase more livestock. Elvira plans to use the receipts from the loan for increasing her numbers of domestic livestock, and in the near-future — to renovate their house.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
As a married mother of nine children, Caridad works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines. Caridad is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Caridad has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Holiyor

texts.ru:
Холиер жизнерадостный мужчина 29 лет. Он женат и имеет двоих детей. Холиер живёт со своей семьёй в сельской местности. Он очень позитивный молодой человек. Холиер старается во всем видеть хорошую сторону. 
Холиер любит, разводить, и ухаживать за крупнорогатым скотом. Он покупает на базаре скот, потом откармливает его и перепродает. Жена Холиер всегда помогает ему в этом. Полученное молоко они продают своим соседям. Соседи с удовольствием покупают у семьи Холиер молоко, потому что продаваемое ими молоко всегда свежие.  Вот уже год Холиер занимается этим делом, от этого дела он получает хороший стабильный доход.
В данный момент Холиер хочет приобрести корм для скота на зиму, для этого ему нужны денежные средства.
Он заранее благодарить «Арванд» за предоставленную помощь и надеется положительный результат.

loans.use: for the purchase of livestock feed

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en: The medium sized enterprise is involved in wood processing,Carpentry and furniture cabins for the local population of about 350,000 inhabitants. BODSEC Enterprise has been in the carpentry and wood processing business for the past 25years. The business was a family owned one which was handed down to the present manager by his father. Mr N. the current manager infused into the business best business practices he learnt from the TEACH lending skills program of Kraban Support Foundation. After the training program the manager has now expanded his business based on a 5-year business and marketing plan the company has in place. He needs a KIVA loan of $1900 to enable him purchase an additional wood planer and bench saw machine to augment the enterprise operations.

loans.use: PURCHASE ADDITIONAL WOOD PLANER & BENCH-SAW

loans.name: Amadu

texts.en: Mamadu has a shed in the market where she sells her goods. She sells fabrics, bags, and children's wear. She has a problem transporting her goods from the market centre to her home. She wishes to own a shop where she can sell. She is seeking a loan of $900.00 from Kiva to enable her to do so.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She will invest the loan in the purchase of dressmaking materials and school supplies to stock her store.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen is thirty-five. She is married and has two children. Her husband works in the fields, in the cultivation of sugar cane. She raises pigs. She belongs to the group Limonar 7. Other members of the group are Dolores Cruz Velasco and Amada Gutiérrez Ruiz (who also raise pigs) and Dolores Velasco Avendaño (who sells vegetables). They would use the loan to buy piglets to raise and sell when grown, thereby increasing their profits. Dolores Velasco would invest in a refrigerator to keep her vegetables in good condition for a longer time.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio Padial, Kiva Volunteer

CARMEN tiene 35 años, casada, dos hijos, su esposo trabaja en el campo en el cultivo de la caña. Ella se dedica a la crianza de puercos. Pertenece al grupo Limonar 7. las otras integrantes del grupo son: Dolores Cruz Velasco y Amada Gutiérrez Ruiz ambas se dedican a la crianza de puercos y doña Dolores Velasco Avendaño a la venta de verduras. Con el préstamo esperan invertir en animales pequeños para su engordamiento y de esta forma aumentar sus ganancias, y doña Dolores Velasco espera invertir en un conservador y así mantener en buen estado y mas tiempo sus verduras.

loans.use: To buy livestock and a refrigerator for vegetables

loans.name: Herminio

texts.en:
Herminio is 47 years old, and he and his wife of 23 years, Isabel, have 4 children together. When he was 27 he started working cultivating his land. At this time he and his wife decided to take their small savings of US $160 and invest it to create a small garden where they cultivated various types of vegetables.

Thanks to their effort and enthusiasm, after 20 years they continue to dedicate themselves to the same business which they have now expanded into a large production where they grow an enormous variety of agricultural products. All of the children help them on the farm in addition to 19 employees who help with different activities such as irrigation, cultivation and plowing the land.

Currently he distributes his products to various supermarkets. His dream is to construct an artesian well for the irrigation of his cultivations. At the moment Herminio is asking for a loan to build a greenhouse to increase his output.

loans.use: Construction of a greenhouse

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is married and has a daughter. She and her family live in Kherson, Ukraine. Tatyana sells women’s clothing and light footwear in the Dneprovskyi market. Her business has a big advantage – its favorable location in the busy market. Tatyana started out as an entrepreneur six years ago. She strives to buy high-quality goods and to give excellent service, and she has made a favorable impression on her customers. Today Tatyana has about $3500 in inventory. Her monthly net profit is about $400. She has fully repaid the two loans she previously received from Nadiya Ukraine.

In spite of her excellent reputation and satisfied customers, she doesn’t want to stop at this stage. She wants to continue growing and developing both professionally and personally. She is requesting a loan of $1000 to re-stock her inventory for the winter season. We believe that Tatyana’s perseverance and careful planning will help her to repay this current loan while honing her business skills.

loans.use: Increase inventory of winter clothing

loans.name: Zulmira

texts.es:
Zulmira is 40 years old and dedicates herself to the sale of soft drinks and also to the sale of clothing. Her husband, Sergio Vargas, helps her in the sale of clothing and is who encourages her to move ahead in each one of the projects she sets out to accomplish. Her daughter, who is 19 years old, supports her in the soft drink business. The most important thing for Zulmira is supporting her daughter, who is studying toward a professional career, and her dream is for her to reach that goal without any difficulties. She has always seen herself as an active woman since she has been dedicating herself to the sale of many different products since she was very young. She now feels very happy to own her own business; however, it is necessary for her to finish implementing it now that she has established a strong customer base. With the hope of her business flourishing the way she envisions it, she extends her request and hopes to count with your vital support to materialize each of the goals she has set for herself.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Zulmira, de 40 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de bebidas heladas y también a la venta de prendas de vestir, su esposo, Sergio Vargas, la ayuda en la venta de las prendas de vestir y es quien la incentiva a seguir adelante con cada uno de los proyectos que se propone, mientras que su hija de 19 años la apoya en su negocio de venta de bebidas heladas. Para ella lo más importante ahora es apoyar a su hija, ya que está estudiando una carrera técnica y lo único que desea es que llegue a culminarla sin que se susciten problemas en su camino.Desde siempre se ha identificado como una mujer activa, por lo que se dedicaba a la venta de distintos productos desde muy joven, ahora se siente muy feliz al tener un negocio propio; sin embargo le es menester implementarlo ya que tiene una importante acogida de sus clientes.A fin de que su negocio surja como ella lo espera, les extiende su solicitud y espera contar con vuestro importante apoyo para concretar cada uno de los planes que se ha propuesto.

loans.use: Implement a small soft drink business.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Mrs. Comfort E. a 46 years old, married with 5 children, lives in Benin City, sells garri and Plantain, she is soliciting for the loan of $450 to buy more garri and plantain. She learnt her trade from her mother-in-law & started hers in 1990. She is a dedicated LAPO client.

loans.use: To buy more garri & Plantain for sale

loans.name: Hom

texts.en:
Mrs. Hom P., 49, is a widow with four children and works on her rice paddy growing rice and vegetables, making collectively around $4 each day in income. Her married daughter is employed by a garment factory; another child attends school and the other children work producing incense to sell to the people in their area.

Mrs. Hom P. hopes to use this loan to purchase another rice paddy to expand her crops to enable her to generate an additional profit. (She is pictured with her two little grand-daughters.)

loans.use: To purchase another rice paddy to expand her crops so she can generate additional profit

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
With two grown-up children, Mrs. Nguyen Thi T., 55 years old, now lives with her husband and her youngest child. Although old age, Mrs. T. is still very hard working. Her main job is to breed cows and pigs. She uses her own fund and the loan from TYM (Kiva Partner in Vietnam) to buy the piglets. Each year she sells some litters of pigs, which brings her an income of about 1000USD. Besides jobs, Mrs. T. often participates in social activities in her group and branch. Her husband and children always whole-heartedly support her. She wants to borrow 450USD to buy piglets. Mrs. T. is now living in Hung Nguyen district, Nghe An province.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

2 người con lớn đã trưởng thành, chị Nguyễn Thị Tám, 55 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và người con út. Mặc dù đã tương đối nhiều tuổi nhưng chị vẫn tích cực lao động kinh tế. Công việc chính của chị Tám là chăn nuôi bò và lợn. Số tiền mua lợn được lấy từ nguồn vốn tự có của gia đình và vay Quỹ Tình thương. Mỗi năm chị cho xuất chuồng vài lứa lợn mang lại thu nhập khoảng 1000USD. Không những làm kinh tế, chị Tám còn thường xuyên tham gia các sinh hoạt văn hóa xã hội tại cụm, chi nhánh. Hoạt động này được chồng con chị rất hiểu và ủng hộ. Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 450USD để mua thêm lợn con về nuôi. Chị Tám hiện đang sống tại Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ An.

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Comité Paraíso Group

texts.es:
This group is made up of 15 enterprising women who perform different types of activities in order to generate a better income for their families. All of them, besides being dedicated mothers and spouses, perform diverse activities such as, for example, selling fruit, vegetables and other staple foods, managing kiosks, selling clothes and cakes and working as seamstresses.

  The women are currently in the third cycle of the program and assure us that it has been very helpful to them since they have learned to save money and work as a team. They are a very reliable group when it comes to payments and attending their weekly meetings.

This group of women, who call themselves “Paradise,” is requesting a loan in order to purchase additional merchandise to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Este grupo de mujeres emprendedoras esta conformado por 15 señoras que realizan distintos tipos de actividades para generar mayores ingresos a sus familias. Todas, además de ser madres y esposas dedicadas, realizan diversos tipos de actividades como por ejemplo venta de frutas, verduras, despensas, kioscos, venta de ropas, venta de tortas, costureras, etc.
