Se encuentran en el tercer ciclo del programa y aseguran que el mismo les ha sido de gran ayuda, ya que aprendieron a ahorrar y trabajar en equipo. Son un grupo muy cumplidor en sus pagos y en las reuniones que se realizan cada semana.

El comité lleva por nombre El Paraíso, y solicitan un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de mercaderías para su venta.

loans.use: Purchase fabric, yarn, meat, beverages, milk, cooking oil, pasta, rice, flour, mens furnishings and linens

loans.name: Halima's Udugu Group

texts.en:
Halima is 30 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages 15, 9 and 4 years old. Halima sells rice. She started in 2007. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $65 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more rice for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Asia and Mwanaisha, who have businesses dealing in food vending and salon.

loans.use: To buy more rice for her business.

loans.name: Agossou

texts.fr:
Mr. Agossou A. was born February 29th, 1976 in Lomé. He is single and taking care of a child. In 1999 he established a store selling spare parts in Adawlato neighborhood of Lomé. He imports replacement parts from Germany and Nigeria. He is a major supplier of motor oil, batteries, belts, and other parts. His main customers are specialized and four-wheel drive mechanics. Currently stocks of certain parts have fallen noticeably and for this reason Mr. Agossou A. is seeking his first loan to buy 50 oil filters, 11 belts, 20 spark plugs, and batteries. With this new stock, he will be able to satisfy his customers and in turn make a good profit.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur A. Agossou est né le 29 février 1976 à Lomé. Il est célibataire avec un enfant à charge. Depuis 1999 il a crée un magasin de vente des pièces détachées dans le quartier de Adawlato à Lomé. Il importe les pièces de rechange de l’Allemagne et du Nigeria. Il est un grand fournisseur d’huile à moteur de batterie, de courroie et d’autres pièces de rechange. Ses principaux clients sont les mécaniciens à quatre roues et les particuliers. Présentement les stocks de certains pièces ont subi une diminution sensible raison pour laquelle Monsieur A. Agossou sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter cinquante (50) filtres à huile, onze (11) courroies, 20 paquets de bougie d’allumage et des batteries. Ainsi avec ce nouveau stock, il pourra satisfaire ces clients et en retour dégager un bon bénéfice.

loans.use: Purchase of replacement parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Asha's Wastara Group

texts.en:
Asha  is 48 years old. She is a married woman with 3 children aged 21, 17  and 14. She became a charcoal and juice seller in 2001. Every day, she works from 7am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

Asha now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member who also has business dealing with clothes and shoe sales.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Ul

texts.en:
Ul S., 37, is a fish seller and lives with two of her children in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Since 1998, she has been selling fish and is able to make around $5 profit per day. Her husband owns a pond that raises a few kinds of fish. Her husband always provides fish to her and also distributes fish to other venders in the market to earn approximately $7 in revenue per day. Mrs. Ul is requesting a loan from Kiva via Credit, a local partner, to purchase feed for fish in bulk. The rest of the loan is to raise more fish.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To purchase feed for fish in bulk and to raise more fish

loans.name: Glorious Pat

texts.en: Glorious Pat O. is 29 years old and she is married with a child. She sells provisions like tomato paste, butter, sugar, etc. She also sells foodstuffs and drinks. She opens her shop by 8am and closes by 7pm. She is a hardworking woman. She desires to retain her customers by stocking her shop with all that her customers need. She needs a loan of $425 to buy more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and Provisions for sale

loans.name: Sharifahon

texts.en:
Sharifahon has sold fabrics and window curtains for almost nine years. She is very experienced in this business. One of her three children helps her with her business. Her husband sells dried apricots at the market.

Sharifahon buys her goods from other markets in another city which is about 80 miles from her home. She wants to borrow money so she can buy larger quantities of goods when she goes to this city.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her shop

loans.name: Ergash

texts.en:
H. Ergash is a father who has devoted himself to independent agriculture tasks for the past 8 years cultivating potatoes, onions and carrots.  His daily efforts and the care of his fields assure him a good harvest as well as profits, so that his four children can continue their education. 

Ergash has dreamed of extending his lands and wants to obtain a loan to invest in his current land by purchasing seeds and fertilizer to earn greater profits and reach the goal he has set for himself.  Ergash thanks everyone supporting him and promises to repay the loan with no violations.

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds and mineral fertilizer for sowing potatoes and onions

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
“In everything I do, I always put God first. My wife and I dream of sending our two children to school to finish their college education, improving our house, and having a better future,” says Victor.

Victor acts as the father and mother to their two children: Vielo, 8 years old, an elementary student; and Arvie, 20 years old, a college student. His wife, Divina, is working as a domestic helper abroad. They live in a progressive community of Barangay Magassi Cabagan, Isabela. 

With the help of his wife, he was able to purchase his own tricycle that he operates in their village. This serves as another source of income to them. His income is just enough to meet the daily expenses of their family and as payment for his tricycle loan.

Victor would like to borrow a loan for the maintenance of his tricycle, like gasoline, oil, rubber wheels, chains and sprocket.

loans.use: Maintenance of the tricycle

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi: Chị Trần Thị V., năm nay 41 tuổi, có 2 con đều đang đi học. Chị tham gia Quỹ từ năm 2003, số vốn chị vay chủ yếu được gia đình chị đầu tư vào chăn nuôi và dệt chiếu cho thu nhập bình quân  100.000đ/ngày. Với việc sử dụng nguồn vốn có hiệu quả đã giúp gia đình chị có thêm điều kiện cho con ăn học và mua sắm thêm tiện nghi cho gia đình. Vòng vốn tới chị muốn vay 9000.000 để mua nguyên vật liệu diệt chiếu và phân bón để gia tăng sản xuất.
texts.en:
Mrs. Tran Thi V. is 41 years old. She has two children, both of them are still in school. She joined TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam) since 2003. Her family has primarily invested her loans in raising animals and making sedge mat, which brings them an average income of 100,000VND (about 5.8 USD) per day. While the loan is used efficiently, Mrs. V. is able to provide her children with proper schooling and to buy more furniture for the house. This time she would like to borrow 9,000,000 VND (or 525 USD) to buy more materials to make mats and fertilizers for her cattle.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising, make  mats

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose L. is currently in the business of selling cold drinks at the hotel. Rose is 40 years old and widowed. She has five children and all her children go to school. She is requesting a loan to expand the business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business selling cold drinks.

loans.name: Lesbia Elisalda

texts.es:
La microempresaria Lesbia Elisalda B. P. ha trabajado en la venta de ropa por muchos años.  Siempre había querido su propio negocio, y hace 5 años logró a establecer una venta de ropa usada en el Barrio Central de la ciudad de Bluefields.  La ropa que ella vende es de los EEUU y la compra de Managua.  Con este negocio bien establecido, Lesbia tiene una buena red de clientes habituales, y ella los avisa cuando tiene una paca nueva.  

Lesbia es casada y tiene 4 hijos.  Su esposo es chaufer de taxi y ayuda en los gastos para la familia.  Lesbia ya ha recibido un préstamo de ADEPHCA y lo usó para aumentar su negocio y no tenía ningún problema con los pagos del préstamo.  Porque tuvo tanto éxito con el primer préstamo, ella está pidiendo más esta vez.  Con este dinero, va a comprar una paca de ropa niño por US$ 200, una paca de ropa adulto por US$ 150, una paca de sábanas por US$ 150, y una paca de toallas por US$ 100.  Ha vendido la mayoría de estas cosas en el pasado, pero va a usar parte de este préstamo para aumentar su negocio para incluir sábanas, que nunca ha vendido y tiene clientes pidiéndolas.  

Lesbia tiene muchos sueños para su familia.  Ahora tiene una casa de madera, y le gustaría hacerla de cemento.  También, tiene hijos que quieren ir a universidades buenas en la ciudad de León, que queda en otra parte de Nicaragua.  Ella dice que esto es costoso y difícil, pero quiere lo mejor para sus hijos y sigue trabajando duro para ellos.
texts.en:
Small-businesswoman Lesbia Elisalda B. has worked in clothing sales for many years. She had always wanted her own business, and 5 years ago she established one selling used clothing in the Barrio Central neighborhood of the city of Bluefields. The clothing she buys is from the United States and she buys it in Managua. With this business being well-established, Lesbia has a good network of habitual customers, and she lets them know when she has a new bundle of clothing. Lesbia is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a taxi driver and helps with the family’s expenses. Lesbia has already received a loan from ADEPHCA and she used it to grow her business and she had no troubles with the payments for the loan. Since she had such success with the first loan, she is requesting another. With this money, she will buy a bale of children’s clothing for US $200.00, a bale of adult clothing for US$150.00, a bale of sheets for US$150.00, and a bale of towels for US$100. She has sold the majority of these things in the past, but she will use a part of this loan to grown her business to include sheets, which she has never sold but which customers are requesting. Lesbia has many dreams for her family. She currently has a wooden house, and she would like to build one of cement. Also, she has children who want to go to good universities in the city of León, which is located in a different area Nicaragua. She says it is difficult and expensive, but she wants the best for her children and so she keeps working hard for them.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

video.title: Lesbia Elisalda - Kiva entrepreneur from  Nicaragua

loans.use: To buy one bundle each of children's clothing, adult clothing, sheets, and towels.

loans.name: Albertine

texts.fr:
A. Albertine  est née vers 1981 à Ganvié, village lacustre dans le département de l'Atlantique au Sud du Bénin. A. Albertine  est mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont seul l'aîné est scolarisé. 
Depuis son enfance A. Albertine  vend du poisson frais d’abord pour  mère ensuite pour son propre compte.  Mais, il y a deux mois,  A. Albertine  a commencé aussi à  vendre de  la nourriture  (haricot préparé , mangé avec le  pain ou la farine de manioc et de l’huile rouge).  A. Albertine a déjà deux crédits avec ALIDé.  A. Albertine  veut un  troisième crédit  pour  renforcer  son activité de vente de nourriture.  A. Albertine espère  avec ses revenus, aider son mari, un pêcheur, à acquérir une barque pour la pêche. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Albertine A. was born circa 1981 in Ganvié, a lake village in the Atlantique district, in Southern Benin. Albertine is married and has three children, of which only the eldest goes to school. Since she was a child, Albertine has been selling fish, first with her mother, then on her own. But two months ago, Albertine also started to sell food (prepared beans, to be eaten with bread or manioc flour and red oil). Albertine has already received two credits with ALIDé. She requested a third loan to strengthen her food sales activity. Albertine hopes to help her husband who is a fisherman with her profits, to buy a small boat to go fishing. The meaning of ALIDé in Benin local language - Fon - is "a path always exists for the poorest". Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria, with a GDP per capita of $1,500. ALIDé offers special credits at 0% interest rate for very vulnerable people, and is part of a group that soon will launch a program of heath micro-insurance for the beneficiaries of a micro-credit.

Translated from French by anne-laure behaghel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a bag of beans and gari (manioc flour), 50 litres of red oil, a basket of chili, a basket of oignons.

loans.name: Fuao

texts.en: Fuao T., 26, is married with one child. She has one year of experience in the popcorn business. She sells to the village people and general public, six days per week. She has had no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~105 USD).  SPBD loans are Fuao’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase popcorn and a tank of oil to start her business

loans.name: Maxima

texts.es:
La Señora Maxima es Socia del Banco Comunal Manuela Ramos, del Distrito de Mazo-Cruz,Provincia del Collao, Departamento de Puno, tiene 40 eños de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 2 hijos, y posee estudios de primaria incompleta (cuarto grado).
Trebaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 7 años, y se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, su primer prestamo fue de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió aumentar su capital.
Con este crédito de 600.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará abarrotes como fideos, azúcar, leche, etc. 
Desea anpliar su tiena vendiendo al por mayor.  Está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, le gusta la forma de los préstamos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maxima is a member of the Manuela Ramos Community Bank, in the district of Mazo Cruz, in the province of Collao, in Puno. She is 40 years old, is married, has 2 children, and has completed up to fourth grade of primary school. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 7 years and sells groceries. Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles, which allowed her to increase her capital. With this loan of 600 nuevos soles, she will buy groceries, such as noodles, sugar, milk, etc. She wants to grow her store, selling wholesale. She is very thankful to Manuela Ramos, because she likes the form of the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, noodles, tuna, semolina, and oil

loans.name: Patricia Maribel

texts.es:
La señora Patricia Maribel R. R. tiene 35 años, vive en el distrito de Florencia de Mora, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad; Perú.
Ella estudió Secundaria Completa, tiene 2 hijos que dependen económicamente de ella.
Patricia se dedica a la venta de joyas de oro y plata, este negocio lo desarrolla conjuntamente con su esposo quien se encarga de la fabricación, anteriormente fabricaban en pocas cantidades, ahora lo distribuye en diversas joyerías de la ciudad de Trujillo.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal Unidas para un Futuro Mejor II, lo invirtió en la compra de material para la elaboración de joyas como el oro y la plata
Con el crédito de 2000 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de materiales como cremas y ceras en barra, gasolina, bencina, oro y plata.
Patricia tiene como sueño poner una tienda exclusiva para la venta de joyas.
texts.en:
Patricia Maribel R. R., 35, lives in the Florencia de Mora district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She has a high school education. She has two dependent children. Patricia sells gold and silver jewelry. She and her husband run the business. He makes the jewelry. Previously, he made small amounts. Now, they distribute to various jewelry stores in the city of Trujillo. With the first loan of 300 PEN that she received from her community bank, Unidadas para un Futoro Mejor II, she bought materials like gold and silver for making jewelry. With this loan for 2,000 PEN she will buy materials like creams, bars of wax, gasoline, benzene, gold and silver. Patricia’s dream is to set up an exclusive jewelry store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy creams, bars of wax, gasoline, benzene, gold and silver

loans.name: Channy

texts.en: Mrs. Channy L. is 37 years old and she lives in Kaoh Prak village in Kandal province. She is a Chinese noodle seller in the local market. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more noodles and ingredients to add to her soup to make it more delicious. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family’s living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Sout Rous, is a policeman in a local district. Mrs. Channy L. has two children who are attending the local school. The other four people in the picture is a group guarantee.

loans.use: Purchasing more noodles and ingredients for soup making business.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.en:
Bertha A. is thirty-one years old and is married, with two children who are currently in school. She owns and operates a beauty salon in her neighborhood at Suhum in the eastern region of Ghana where she lives with her family.

Bertha is very skillful and a talented hairdresser and has two apprentices who are learning skills for their future dependency. She believes in efficiency and effectiveness of service. Therefore, she wants to use the loan to buy a larger quantities of hair products like weavons (hair extensions), pomade, shampoo, activators etc., to serve her customers. She has won so many customers in the community who come to her salon to have their hair done. She said it is mostly the weekends that customers come in numbers as most of them will be going to work on weekdays.

Bertha will be grateful for your assistance. She belongs to the village bank called ‘Nyame Mmoa’ meaning God’s Help.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of hair products like weavons, pomade, shampoo, activators etc.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy N. is 38 and is a single mother of one. She owns a clothing boutique that has been in operation for 5 years. Nancy learned about KADET from a friend and decided to join us. This will be her first loan to boost her business.

With the 80,000 Kenyan shilling loan Nancy plans to purchase more clothes, tailoring garments and sewing threads for her boutique. She also sells soft drinks and beverages in her shop to supplement her income. Her main customers are residents of Shanzu. In the future Nancy hopes to expand her boutique business and also to start making school uniforms.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To purchase new clothing stock, and also to buy tailoring material and sewing thread.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia E. is from the village of Panalsan. She is 64 years old. Lucia is married. To make a living, Lucia owns & operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Lucia has been engaged in her business for over 35 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Lucia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fish to sell. Lucia is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 16th loan taken out by Lucia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Chérubins Plus Group

texts.fr:
Chérubins Plus est un groupe composé de 33 membres dont Modeste M. est président. Ce groupe a déjà reçu les prêts de Kiva qu’il a remboursé correctement.
Modeste a comme activités commerciales, la fabrication artisanale des savons qu’il vend ainsi qu’une cabine téléphonique. Ses affaires se localisent dans le quartier périphérique le plus peuplé de Kinshasa, situé au nord de la ville. Pour réaliser son ambition d’ouvrir une usine de fabrication des savons à fournir aux détaillants, Modeste travaille durement en réinvestissant ses bénéfices accumulés. Il compte aussi sur les prêts de Kiva à travers Hope. Il en a déjà reçu trois qu’il remboursé totalement. Le prochain crédit lui servira d’acheter des produits de fabrication des savons à revendre en vue d’accroitre le bénéfice. Actuellement, ses activités lui génèrent un bénéfice de $45 par semaine. Modeste est âgé de 54 ans, marié et père de 6 enfants âgés entre 12 et 30 ans. Tous vont à l’école.
texts.en:
Chérubins Plus is a group composed of 33 members, and its president is Mr. Modeste M.. This group has already received Kiva loans that it repaid correctly. Modeste has a commercial business making artisanal soaps, which he sells. He has a telephone booth as well. His businesses are located in the most populated outlying district of Kinshasa and north of the city. To realize his ambition of opening a factory for making soaps to provide to retailers, Modeste works hard while reinvesting his accumulated profits. Also, he is counting on Kiva loans through the micro-finance institution Hope RDC. He has already received three of them, which he totally repaid. The next loan will be used to buy goods for making soaps to sell, with the aim of growing his profits. Currently, his businesses generate a profit of $45 a week for him. Modeste is 54 years old, married, and the father of six children, ages 12 to 30. All of them go to school.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy goods for making soaps to sell

loans.name: Maria Theresa

texts.en:
Maria Theresa D. C. is from the progressive town of Dasmarinas, Cavite. She is 36 years old. Her husband Rafael, 46, is a farmer. They have a very young child.  

Theresa owns and manages a general store. She also sells prepaid credit for mobile phones. Her store is six years old and has a monthly profit of about $370 per month.  

She attributes her store’s success (and her personal success as well) to having joined the Kiva field partner, the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative, in 2007.  

Theresa needs a loan of P13,000 to build up inventories for her store. Competition is stiff in her area. “A store with many items to sell is always inviting to the customers”, she says.  She dreams of converting her general store to a big grocery outlet someday.


About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: Inventory for her store

loans.name: Cecilia's Group

texts.en:
Cecilia is 37 years old, is married, and is the mother of seven children. She lives with her children and her husband in the outskirts of their town. Currently, five of her children are in school at the primary level. Cecilia works very hard as a mother to support her husband in taking care of the family.

Cecilia has been a local manufacturer of soap for two years now. She combines materials like palm oil, soda powder, cocoa pods and coconut oil to obtain her soaps. She is not able to produce in large quantities due to lack of funds. She wants to take advantage of the loan facility to buy more raw materials and processing equipment to scale up production. She hopes to improve her income to support her children’s education. It is her desire to provide quality education to the children and she believes that the loan will make her dream come true.

Cecilia is the leader of a trust bank group called “Nyame Naye” which literally means “It is the doing of the Lord”. She is the one sitting in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and farmers, etc.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials and processing equipment

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en: Mwajuma T. is a small business an entrepreneur Tanzanian business woman. She runs a Grocery at Kigamboni Tungi ward in Dar es Salaam. She sells varieties of goods including soft drinks and food staffs. She is married with four children. The Business income is used to meet her daily demand including business capitalization. She plans to open a food staff’s shop but fund is a problem. She is requesting a loan of Tshs 600,000 to capitalize the business

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Monday

texts.en: Monday, 35 years old and married with three children, sells spare motor parts to make a living. In this business for six years, he hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more spare parts to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more spare motor parts to sell

loans.name: Atoniata

texts.en:
Atoniata L. is currently in the business of selling beer in a bar and is requesting a loan to buy more crates of beer to sell in her bar. Atoniata is 28 years old and is widowed.  She has one child and her child does not go to school yet. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: buy more crates of beer to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth Loechico is a 44-year old beauty salon owner from Malibay, Pasay City.  Her husband, Ramon, 49, works for a funeral parlor. They have four children; one of whom is in college, and two are in high school.

Elizabeth has been in the beauty salon business for fifteen years.  She likes the idea of making people physically beautiful. She gets tired at the end of the day, especially in peak season.  She says she can’t afford to hire help at the moment because her salon is just too small.  But, small as it is, she earns PHP 25, 000.00 a month.  Her profits go to the education of her children as well as to the family’s basic daily needs.

In 2003, she joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative.  She has recently applied for a new loan in the amount of PHP 42, 000.00.  She will use the funds to purchase supplies for her parlor/salon. 

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for the beauty salon.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita L. is from the village of Siempre Viva Sur, Mallig. She is 40 years old. Anita is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Anita owns & operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Anita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Anita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Anita is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Big Family Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the 'Big Family' Group. They are small-scale businesswomen in the small town of Waterloo, near Freetown. They are seeking a loan of SLL 1,800,000 to enable them to expand their businesses.

The leader of this group is Frances N. on the left in the photo. Frances N. is a trained nurse and owns a pharmacy in Waterloo’s main market. In her pharmacy, she sells pain medicines, medicines for colds and malaria. Frances has been selling medicines in this pharmacy for seven years now. With this loan, she will travel to neighboring Guinea as usual to buy in larger quantity the above mentioned medicines.

Frances was born in Kenema, eastern Sierra Leone. She is thirty years of age, single with one child and four foster children. Four of these children are attending secondary schools and one is in primary school.

loans.use: buy pain medicines, medicines for colds, and malaria medicines in larger quantity

loans.name: María Isidra

texts.es: María Isidra L. D. E. D. 46 años D. edad, resiD. en el barrio D. San Jacinto, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Ella es una persona la cual vive sola y que debe trabajar muy duro por poder tener una vida digna. María posee un comedor en el mercado municipal del Barrio San Jacinto, en el cual elabora y venD. desayunos y almuerzos, así mismo comercializa bebidas frías y calientes. Debido a que ya posee muchos años D. tener este negocio, cuenta con una amplia clientela, la cual asiste a su comedor ya que la consideran como una persona D. mucha confianza, así mismo les agrada el buen trato que ella les brinda. María solicita un préstamo con el deseo D. poder aumentar sus ventas, ya que ella espera poder comprar, verduras, arroz, frijoles, maíz y una mayor cantidad D. bebidas. Esto debido a que ella cuenta con la ilusión D. aumentar sus ventas en este nuevo año, es por ello que desea poder brindarles un mejor servicio D. comida a sus clientes y así mismo obtener nuevos clientes.
texts.en:
María Isidra L. D. E., 46, lives in the San Jacinto neighborhood in the San Salvador department. She lives alone and must work very hard to be able to have a decent life. María has a restaurant in the municipal market in the San Jacinto neighborhood. She makes and sells breakfasts and lunches. She also sells hot and cold drinks. Because she has so many years in this business she has a lot of customers. They come to her restaurant because they have confidence in her, and they like the good treatment she gives them. María is asking for a loan to be able to increase her sales. She hopes to be able to buy vegetables, rice, beans, corn, and a greater quantity of drinks. She hopes to increase her sales in this New Year. She wants to be able to offer her customers better food service. That way she will get new customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy vegetables and basic grains

location.town: San Jacinto , departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Nget

texts.en: Mrs. Nget K. lives in Angk Roveay village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Phal Daok, are silk weavers. Since their business is going well from day-to-day, Mrs. Nget K. wants to expand it. She needs 2,000,000 Riel from AMK to buy more silk and raw materials to support her silk weaving. Mrs. Nget K. has six children, three of whom are silk weavers and the others are attending the local school. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more silk for weaving.

loans.name: Ramon Alejandro

texts.es: El señor Ramón Alejandro V., vive en una comunidad de nombre san Pedro, su propiedad tiene 12 manzanas de extensión con diferentes tipos de aéreas para explotación para trabajos, tiene 2 manzanas que las utiliza para cultivar granos básicos (frijol y maíz), 10   manzanas apta para el cuido y manejo de ganado, el se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos de consumo como cultivo de frijol y maíz y al manejo de ganado. La razón para la cual utilizara este financiamiento. Es para comprar 2 toretes para desarrollo los que cuidara hasta que estos adquieran un mayor peso y después los venderá a un mejor precio del que adquirió. Este cliente inicio o comenzó su actividad de trabajo con una herencia de una propiedad de 5 manzanas que le dieron sus padres y ahí comenzó a cultivar granos básicos frijol y maíz,  únicamente en épocas de invierno, todo el tiempo desde la edad de 13 años el siempre se ha dedicado a estas actividades de trabajo de campo, esto lo hacía con ayuda de su esposa quien le apoya a realizar otras actividades importantes en el hogar, ejemplo en un dio normal de trabajo ambos se levantan temprano el a preparar las herramientas que llevara al campo y su esposa a preparar los alimentos que el llevara a su trabajo, de esta forma ambos se apoyan y ayudan para poder realizar sus actividades de trabajo. Actualmente continua en esta actividades de agrícolas y ganaderas, con esto el espera seguir mejorando su actividad de trabajo y poder aumentar más su operatividad en todo tiempo ya que su principal fuente o forma de trabajo es la agricultura en épocas de invierno y en verano con esto del manejo de ganado el obtendrá otra alternativa o fuente que le genere ingresos, con esta otra alternativa le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos. Para Don Ramón Alejandro V., este es el primer año de trabajar con Ceprodel y su primer crédito. El impacto y beneficios que espera tener para él y su familia es de una forma positiva ya que con esta otra alternativa el podrá obtener otros ingresos que le permitirán mejorar su actividades de trabajo y nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Ramón Alejandro V. lives in a community called San Pedro. His property has 12 “manzanas” (1 manzana = 1.68 acres), and he uses different areas for different activities. He uses two manzanas to grow basic grains (beans and corn) and ten manzanas to raise livestock. He plants basic consumable grains like beans and corn and raises cattle. That is the reason for the loan. He will buy two small bulls to raise until they gain more weight. He will then sell them for a better price than what he paid for them. This client set up and started his work activity with an inheritance of five manzanas of property that his parents gave him. He started to grow basic grains like beans and corn on that property only during the winter season. Since he was 13 he has always done this field work. He did this with his wife’s help; she helps with other important activities in their house. An example of a normal work day is for both of them to get up very early to prepare the tools he will take to the field. His wife prepares the food he will take to his work. This way they both support and help each other in their work. He currently continues with his agricultural and livestock activities. He hopes to continue improving his work activity in order to be able to increase his operation all of the time. In the winter season his primary source or way of working is farming. In the summer he gets an alternative source of income from raising livestock. This allows him to improve his income. This is Ramón Alejandro V.’s first year of working with Ceprodel, and it is his first loan. The impact and benefit that he expects for his family and himself is positive. With this other alternative he will be able to get other income that will allow him to improve his work activities and his living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy two small bulls

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en: Sandra R.'s main source of income comes from making and selling fish paste in her community. She is a 32-year-old single woman from the town of Puelay Villasis, Pangasinan. Sandra has been in her business for over four years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Sandra joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Sandra is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn E., 46, is making sure that her family has adequate provision for their daily needs. She is married to Noel E., a salesman, and they are blessed with four children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been selling car batteries for quite some time now.

Jocelyn has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings* and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow five times from CCT’s cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her business.

Now, with your help, Jocelyn would like to obtain a PHP 12,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying more car batteries of different brands.

Jocelyn dreams that her business will be successful and that she will be able to put up new branches in other locations.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more car batteries of different brands

loans.name: Tunas Mekar Asih Group

texts.en: Ni Made Arini (0) is a 37-year-old female living in the town of Melaya, Bali. She is the group leader of a fifteen-member group loan offered by MUK. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Tunas Mekar Asih Group (MUK-0015). Ni Made is married and has two school-aged children. She owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 150,000 IDR a month. In 2009, Ni Made joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000,000 IDR from MUK. This previous loan was used to purchase piglets. Ni Made is now requesting a new loan of 1,500,000 IDR which will again be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. The loan will be her 2nd from MUK. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About MUK: The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives. ***************************************************** Ni Made arini (0) merupakan 37 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota melaya-bali. Ni Made adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 15 anggota. Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar. Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah tunas mekar asih (MUK-0015). Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Ni Made sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 2 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Made menghasilkan sekitar 150,000 IDR. Dalam 2009, Ni Made bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Made telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya sebesar 1,000,000 IDR dari MUK. Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli ternak indukan. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,500,000 IDR. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK. Tentang MUK: Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta V. had always dreamed of seeing her three children graduate with degrees. However, she and her husband, Salvador, did not have enough money to provide for their education so they have only reached elementary schooling. They have been unwaged until now because educational attainment is one of the major factors for gaining employment. Violeta thinks that, due to poverty, they have less opportunity than the wealthy. If she and her husband had at least had a small business, they may have had enough money and her dream for her children could have been achieved.

Regardless of what has happened, Violeta doesn’t like to remain unhappy. She wants to find a way to improve her family's quality of living. For this aspiration, she joined Kiva's partner, ASHI, and has been very happy to be given the chance of having working capital. The first few loans she received enabled her to operate a tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar) business. The profit from this business has been the main source of family income.

Now that she and her husband have secured access to capital, her proceeds are better than before. For that reason, she is now requesting another ASHI loan through Kiva for a much bigger amount. Specifically, the loan funds will be used to buy spare parts and pay for maintenance of her tricycle. This will enable her to grow their business further so that they have savings in the future. Her long-term dreams are to continue supporting her children and grandchildren as well as building a home strong enough to withstand the flooding which is common in her province. Also, she dreams of having an additional new tricycle to earn more income so that they can move further away from the cycle of poverty.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and pay for her tricycle's maintenance

loans.name: Miriam Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Miriam del Carmen L. Reyes, es una persona  emprendedora dueña de un negocio de venta de ropa, zapatos y cosméticos. El cual comenzó con un capital inicial de C$8,000.00 que lo adquirió producto de un préstamo hace 10 años. Este negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación. 
 El crédito solicitado es para invertir en capital de trabajo del negocio; como es la compra de pantalones, blusas, zapatos nacionales y cosméticos.
Es  casada, tiene dos hijos a su cargo, actualmente ninguno se  encuentra en el colegio. Dice que antes de tener este negocio ella Trabajaba como domestica.

Lleva 12 créditos en  CEPRODEL a lo largo de 5 años los cuales ha invertido en su negocio con los que ha ido creciendo, diversificando sus productos para poder competir en el mercado, esto gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL.
texts.en:
La señora Miriam del Carmen L. Reyes, es una persona emprendedora dueña de un negocio de venta de ropa, zapatos y cosméticos. El cual comenzó con un capital inicial de C$8,000.00 que lo adquirió producto de un préstamo hace 10 años. Este negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación. El crédito solicitado es para invertir en capital de trabajo del negocio; como es la compra de pantalones, blusas, zapatos nacionales y cosméticos. Es casada, tiene dos hijos a su cargo, actualmente ninguno se encuentra en el colegio. Dice que antes de tener este negocio ella Trabajaba como domestica. Lleva 12 créditos en CEPRODEL a lo largo de 5 años los cuales ha invertido en su negocio con los que ha ido creciendo, diversificando sus productos para poder competir en el mercado, esto gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para  invertir en la compra de mercadería como: ropa, zapatos y cosméticos.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: Reyna Isabel tiene 35 años, ella inicio este negocio hace 4años, y fue por iniciativa propia pues su esposo también le ayuda a manejar el negocio. Reyna tiene 3 hijos a su cargo pues las ganancias que obtiene son necesarias para solventar los gastos de su hogar, pues para el futuro le gustaría incrementar su capital de trabajo pues siempre ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable y puntual con sus cuotas. Ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de azúcar, bolsas, frutas, pajillas entre otras cosas. Su deseo es tener un local en donde ofrezca todo tipo de productos.
texts.en:
Reyna Isabel is 35 years old. She began this business four years ago of her own initiative. Her husband helps her to manage the business. Reyna has three children in her care, and the earnings she receives are necessary to meet household expenses. In the future, she would like to increase her working capital. She has always proven to be responsible and punctual with her loan payments. She is requesting this financing for the purchase of sugar, sacks, fruits, and drinking straws, among other things. She wants to have a place that offers all types of products.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en: Loan T. T. was born in 1957 and lives in Ha Lam village. She has five children (four girls and a boy), three of whom are married. Loan not only grows rice but also raises 300 ducks. Her husband is a builder. They have a monthly income of about 5,000,000 VND. Loan wants to have a better life so she and her husband always work hard. She has participated in Kiva partner, SEDA, since 2004 and always repaid her loans on time. She wants to borrow 7,630,000 VND to buy duck feed.

loans.use: To buy duck feed

loans.name: Hector

texts.es: Héctor, de 39 años, es un padre de familia muy amoroso y responsable, vive en una casa alquilada en la ciudad de Kivinaki, pero tiene su casa propia cerca de su chacra y lo que más desea es brindarle un mejor futuro a su esposa Delfa de 33 años y a sus 3 queridos hijos. Los arduos días de trabajo que tiene Héctor en su chacra, han hecho que sus cultivos se conviertan en uno de los más productivos de su poblado, él trabaja sin descanso ya que sabe que de su esfuerzo depende la alimentación y educación de sus hijos. Lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, asimismo considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos hasta la ciudad de Pichanaki, que es donde vende sus productos. Con el tiempo, espera comprar más tierras para aumentar su producción. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, espera cumplir con todas sus cuotas a tiempo y así no perjudicar a las socias de su grupo comunal, en donde es muy respetado por la responsabilidad que demuestra. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará abono y fertilizantes para mejorar la productividad de sus tierras.
texts.en:
Héctor is a loving and responsible father. He lives in a rented house in the city of Kivinake. He has his own house close to his farm. What he wants most is to give his 33 year old wife, Delfa, and their three dear children a better future. The arduous work days that Héctor has on his farm have made his crops one of the most productive in his town. He works without rest because he knows that feeding and educating his children depends upon his effort. He has been doing this activity for ten years. What he likes most about his work is harvesting his land. The most difficult part is transporting his crops to the city of Pichanaki, which is where he sells his products. In time, he wishes to buy more land to increase his production. This is his second loan with MFP. He expects to make all of his payments on time. That way he will not harm the members of his communal bank. He is much respected in his communal bank because of the responsibility that he demonstrates. He will use the requested 2,000 PEN to buy natural and chemical fertilizers to improve the productivity of his land.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy natural and chemical fertilizers to improve productivity

loans.name: Men Of Action Group

texts.en:
These are small scale businessmen from the small town of Waterloo, Western Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, seeking a loan of 800,000 leones (SLL) each to enable them to expand their businesses. With a loan of 800,000 SLL, they will be able to add more stock to their businesses, make more sales and more profit. 

Alhajie K. is the leader of this group. He was born in Lunsar, a small town in Northern Sierra Leone. He is 25 years old. He is married and has two children. Alhajie sells house-building materials and has been doing this business for ten years now. With this loan, he will buy locks, padlocks, paint, cement, iron rods, etc.

loans.use: To buy locks, padlocks, paint, cement, iron rods, etc.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan P., 30, is married with three young children living at home in the Takeo province. He works as a farmer and collects palm juice, typically making US$3 each day. Hhis wife is a professional tailor. His wife, Yuon Phary, typically makes about US$2 each day as a tailor. Chan P. would like a loan of US$1000 to purchase cows to help with the farmland.

loans.use: To purchase cows to help with the farmland

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en:
D. Nguyễn Thị (20209050021) is a 38-year-old woman living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. D. owns and operates a business raising livestock for sale. D. has been engaged in this business for over 12 years and earns approximately 3,400,000 VND a month from it.

In 2008, D. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  D. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,600,000 VND from SEDA, which was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. D. is now requesting a new loan of 8,288,000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the 4th loan taken out by D. from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


D. Nguyễn Thị (20209050021) là 38 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, D. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  D. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 12 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, D. kiếm được khoảng 3.400.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2008, D. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  D. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thức ăn gia súc & các loại cung cấp khác.  Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  D. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện điều kiện sống chung của gia đình người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
María de 23 años, en una zona periurbana en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil, ella vende productos Yambal (empresa que ofrece a mujeres emprendedoras comenzar con sus ventas independientes),  aunque esta divorciada ella sigue trabajando para su hijos dos hijos de 7 y 6 años. 

Realiza su trabajo sola, trabaja desde muy temprano ofreciendo los productos a sus vecinos y amigos, vende perfumes, cremas, desodorantes. Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos Yambal como perfumes, cremas, desodorantes. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y ser directora Yambal poder tener su propio local.
texts.en:
María is 23 years old and lives in the periurban area of Orquídeas de Guayaquil. She sells products manufactured by Yanbal, a company that offers women entrepreneurs the opportunity to start their own independent sales businesses. Even though María is divorced, she continues working for her children who are 7 and 6 years of age.

Working alone, she wakes up very early to begin offering products to her neighbors and friends. María sells perfumes, crèmes, and deodorants. With this loan, she wants to buy Yanbal products such as perfumes, crèmes, and deodorants. In the future she wants to finish the construction of her house, become a Yanbal director, and have her own shop.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase perfumes, crèmes, and deodorants

loans.name: Fabian

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE LA O”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Yucay, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba, departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Fabian; el tiene 49 años de edad y es casado y tiene 4 Hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con la artesanía, El socio trabaja junto a su hermano elaborando vasijas de arcilla, vasos, tazas, adornos en general y utensilios de uso doméstico. El socio desea invertir en la compra de insumos para seguir elaborando al por mayor y en un futuro cercano el socio desea exportar al extranjero todo su trabajo. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en su taller de artesanía. 

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Fabian is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen de la O”, which is located in the District of Yucay in Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

He is 49 years old, married, and has four children. Fabian divides his time between his daily activities and making handicrafts. He and his brother work together by making clay vessels, cups, bowls, general decorations, and household utensils. Fabian wants to invest in supplies so that he can continue producing in large quantities. In the near future, he wants to export all of his products to be sold abroad. He is requesting a loan to invest in his craft shop.

Fabian is grateful to everyone who helped him fulfill this dream and promises to complete his payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for his craft shop

loans.name: Yealie

texts.en:
This is 47-year-old Yealie.  She is married and has 3 children aged 32, 28 and 24. She has four additional dependents who live with her because they are relatives of her husband who helps them at home and sends them to school.  

In 1985, Yealie established her rubber bucket, bowl, baskets, and plates business. She began her business because her parents taught her trading since she did not go to school.  Working 7 days a week and 9 hours a day, she earns about 2,650,000 Sierra Leonean leones (SLL) every month from this business. She needs a loan of 4,500,000 SLL.  

Yealie requires a loan in order to purchase more market basket, washing boards, rubber kettles, and sets of pans for resale. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 715,500 SLL. In the future, Yealie plans to make plenty of money to help her husband support their children and improve their business. Yealie is selling in the middle of her competitors but her communication skills and customer care helps her a lot.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy household items for resale

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma A. is from the village of Medallo, Sapang Dalaga. She is 31 years old and single with an infant. To make a living, Alma runs a grocery store. Alma has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2008, Alma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 40,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Alma is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP, which will be used for the expansion of her business. This will be the second loan taken out by Alma from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For the expansion of the business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita A. is from the city of Cataggaman Viejo, Tuguegarao City. She is 46 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. Teresita owns & operates a food production/sales business, selling fish balls and other dimsums to the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

Teresita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. She is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital. This will be her 4th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital

loans.name: Karla Jeannette

texts.es: Karla Jeannette D. R. de 29 años de edad, es una madre de familia muy responsable, la cual tiene como prioridad el ayudarle a su esposo con el sostenimiento del hogar. Ella reside en el departamento de San Salvador, en donde vive junto a su esposo, su hijo de 3 años de edad, y su cuñado de 15 años de edad. Karla se dedica a la elaboración y venta de piñatas, las cuales son elaboradas de alambre, papel de periódico y papel china, estas poseen un buen mercado ya que se utilizan para diversas celebraciones pero en especial para fiestas de cumpleaños. Karla solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda poseer el dinero necesario para comprar toda la materia necesaria para la elaboración de más piñatas, y de este modo mejorar su negocio y así mismo sus ganancias, lo cual es uno de los propósitos principales, ya que le permitirán mejorar su estabilidad familiar.
texts.en:
Karla Jeannette D. R., 29, is a very responsible mother whose main priority is helping her husband support the home. She lives in San Salvador department with her husband, three year old son, and 15 year old brother-in-law.

Karla makes and sells piñatas which are made with wire, newspaper and crepe paper.  They sell well because they are used in various celebrations, especially birthday parties.

Karla is requesting a loan to have money to buy the necessary supplies to make piñatas and improve her business and profits, which is one of her main goals, because that will help her improve family stability.

loans.use: To buy piñata-making supplies: paper, wire, adhesives.

loans.name: Artem

texts.en:
Artem D. is from the town of Aloran. He is 39 years old. Artem is married and has 2 infant-aged children. To make a living, Artem owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing transportation services to local community members. Artem has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Artem joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Artem is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP, which will be used to repair the transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Artem from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair transport vehicle used in the business.

loans.name: The Musarat Hussain Buksh Group

texts.en:
Musarat lives in Multan, which is a famous city in Pakistan known for its history and culture. For the past 16 years, she has lived in an area named Chowk shaheedan, where she lives with her family in a two-room home made of bricks. Musarat is a working woman who operates a boutique business at her home. She offers a variety of stitched clothes to her boutique clients and, due to the quality of her work, people prefer her business to shopping at the markets. 

Musarat is married to H. B. and has six sons. The oldest three are working and the younger three stay at home. Musarat cannot provide them an education due to her limited financial resources. She has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner Asasah to improve her business. She is a new Asasah client and this is her first application. Musarat will use the loan to purchase different varieties of cloth to prepare according to the latest trends to improve her sales. Musarat is hopeful that this investment will result in positive changes to her business and increase her monthly income. She wants to help her family achieve a better standard of life.

loans.use: to purchase cloth

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is thirty-eight years old.  She is single and lives with her two brothers.  Their parents have passed away.  Rosalia and her brothers reside in the district of Tambogrande in the province of Piura in northern Peru.  It is a semi-tropical zone which is very productive in fruits and feed for animals.  Many residents have small fruit plantations or raise animals near their homes.

Rosalia operates a small general store out of her home.  She sells hygienic supplies, dry goods, food, candy and beverages.  She can be found in her store every day, greeting her clients with a smile and selling them the items they require.  On Saturdays and Sundays, Rosalia also sells hamburgers, hot dogs and sodas.  She is happy to be a part of the community, increasing their access to basic items and also providing food to people out for a stroll on the weekends.

This will be Rosalia’s first loan with Edpyme Alternativa.  She appreciates having access to credit at a lower interest rate as a result of the partnership with Kiva.  She plans to invest the funds in expanding her selection of merchandise and purchasing a few items in bulk.  She hopes this will allow her to attract additional clients and further improve the image of her store.  She dreams of having a bigger store and restaurant so that she can provide more income for her family.

loans.use: Expand her selection of merchandise and purchase a few items in bulk.

loans.name: Galbadrah

texts.en:
Galbadrah N. is a married man and lives with his two adult children in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. His two children both attend university. Galbadrah and his wife operate a construction business specializing in the interior and exterior decoration of buildings. He has owned this business for the past 9 years and over this time he has gained a lot of experience.

Before starting his business, he worked as a teacher until 2001 (after graduating from university as a teacher in 1991). After years of successful operation, he was able to buy a new car which enabled him to start operating a new transportation service business to supplement his earnings. Today his working capital exceeds 2,000,000 MNT and monthly sales has reached a level of 800,000 MNT.

Galbadrah is a business man and says, "I want to build a house for my oldest son in the future." He is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan in order to purchase necessary materials and supplies for his construction decoration business.

loans.use: To purchase necessary materials and supplies

loans.name: María Narciza

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Crucita, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora María, tiene 54 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene siete hijos,  seis de ellos ya son mayores de edad y la última tiene 15 años la misma que estudia en colegio, tres de sus hijos  viven con ella. El marido es pescador.

Ella es una ama de casa que para ayudar  a su esposo realiza los créditos para el trabajo o negocio del esposo el cual se dedica a la pesca y venta de los frutos que el mar les da,  trabaja todos los días, hay días que junto a otras personas se van a alta mar desde la tarde y regresan al otro dia  o hasta dos días y regresan por la mañana para entregar sus productos a comerciantes que llegan  hasta sus pangas para llevarlos a los mercados de otras ciudades.
 
Este crédito es para comprar combustibles, redes y otros materiales necesarios para la pesca. Hace 5 años es socia del Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos. Sus sueños son que siempre le vaya bien a su esposo y que en todos sus viajes regrese a salvo.
texts.en:
The members of the Crucita communal bank meet in  Crucita parish in Portoviejo canton, an area known for being surrounded by beautiful beaches that are visited by national and foreign tourists.  It is called “Crucita la Bella” (Crucita the Beautiful).

Here we find Maria, 54, who lives in a common law marriage and has seven sons and daughters, six of whom are adults, and the youngest, is fifteen, a student.  Three of her sons and daughters live with her, and her husband is a fisherman.

Maria is a housewife who, to help her husband, requests the loan for her husband's work or business.   He goes fishing every day and sells the fish that is caught.  Some days he goes way out in the afternoons with other fishermen and they come back the next day, or even two days later, when they return to deliver their catch to the merchants who come to their boats to take the fish to the markets in other cities.

This loan will be used to buy fuel, nets, and other supplies necessary for fishing.  She has been a member of the communal bank and she likes it  for the help that she gets with the loans.  Her dreams are that everything always goes well for her husband and that he returns safely from his fishing trips.

loans.use: To buy fuel, nets and other supplies needed for fishing

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: Esther tiene 57 años, vive con su hija en su casa propia. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a vender comida en un centro educativo, así es que todas las mañanas esta ocupada en la preparación de estos alimentos, que serán distribuidos a los docente y alumnos que son sus principales clientes que consumen su platillos. Generalmente su trabajo termina a las 3PM, pero en ocasiones termina a las 5PM, de esta manera asegura recibir mayor rentabilidad. Siempre disfruta de su trabajo porque le gusta cocinar y esta  activa para  apoyar en la educación de su hija que estudia en la universidad. Afirma que este negocio es rentable, ante esto desea mas adelante tener su restaurante. Es su sexto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en  la compra de algunos productos como: Arroz, azúcar y menestras.
texts.en: Esther is 57 years old and lives with her daughter in a house that she owns.  She has been selling food at an educational center for more than four years.  So, every morning she is busy preparing the foods that will be distributed to the teachers and students, who are her main customers that eat the dishes.  She generally ends work at 3pm, but sometimes finishes at 5pm in order to assure that she receives more income.  She always enjoys her work because she likes to cook and is active in supporting her daughter’s university education.  She says that the business is profitable and wants to have a restaurant in the future.  This is her sixth loan with MFP and she is very happy to know that she has financial support, as she has always proven to be responsible with her payments.  She is also pleased to be part of the communal bank because all of the members are responsible and very supportive people.  She is grateful for all those who will fund the loan she is requesting because it will be very useful for her business’ progress.  With the loan requested, she will invest in the purchase of some products like rice, sugar, and stews.

loans.use: To buy basic products like rice, sugar and stews

loans.name: Godelive

texts.en:
Godelive is 30 years old and is married, with two children between the ages of 1 and 2 years.  Godelive is known for selling a variety of clothes, mainly women's and men's clothes.  This is her third successful year in this business. The hours of her business are from 6am until 6pm every day.  She employs two people in her business.

Godelive has now requested a Kiva loan, via Vision Finance Company, to expand her business by adding a variety of styles, such as women's shirts and some other attractive styles. With this additional business, Godelive will hopefully earn more profit than previously. One portion of the profit will be used to build a secure future for her future family. The other portion of her profit will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more products to expand her business

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: El solicitante inicio el negocio hace tres años cuando una amistad le propuso manejar su vehiculo desde ese día viene desempeñando esa labor es soltero vive en casa familiar no tiene hijos cuenta con buenas referencias  laborales y personales se caracteriza por ser una persona amable honesta y responsable solicita el crédito para darle mantenimiento a su unidad de transporte es por ello que se propone el crédito.
texts.en: He started his business three years ago when a friend suggested being a driver for his car.  Since that day he has this occupation. He is single and he lives in the family home. He does not have children. He has good business and personal references and he is known as a kind, honest, and responsible person. He requests a loan to carry out some maintenance repairs to his car.

loans.use: to carry out maintenace repairs to his car

loans.name: Nam

texts.en: Nam C., 47, resides in the Siem Reap province of Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. C. produces traditional baskets, earning an income of USD 1.5 per day. Her husband is a security guard, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 40 on food and USD 25 on other necessary expenses. C. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for her husband to commute to work

loans.name: Sosefina

texts.en:
Sosefina, a 49-year-old married mother of nine children, has owned and operated an auto repairs business venture or work-shop house for the past four years.
