Mrs. Rattna M. is a mother of two children, who are both too young to study or work. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy more silk and to buy piglets and pig food

loans.name: Daniela

texts.es: Daniela, de 37 años, es madre soltera y  tiene 5 hijos, pero solo  vive con 4 de ellos, en su casa que es propia.Es una mujer emprendedora porque para sacar adelante a sus hijos, vende cerveza y bebidas gasificadas, además prepara comida para vender en su restaurante turístico. Como si fuera poco paralelamente cría decenas de patos y gallinas que enseba para vender y también para preparar sus potajes. Daniela cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos, por eso el negocio le resulta rentable, pues no tiene que pagar a terceras personas, y su espíritu emprendedor hace que piense en instalar una granja muy amplia, para que pueda vender al por mayor. En la actualidad está a la espera de las decenas de cuyes que pidió a una negociante de otra ciudad, y orgullosa cuenta “críe 120 gallinas, las hice crecer desde muy tiernas y las comercialice cada una a 35 soles, por eso estoy segura que este negocio me resultará muy beneficioso”, concluye.Esta es la séptima vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y como ya conoce la metodología de trabajo de su banco comunal, le gusta trabajar de manera organizada y siempre velando por el bienestar del resto de integrantes.Daniela tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra  de  insumos necesarios para continuar preparando comida, además adquirirá  cerveza, bebidas gasificadas y algunas golosinas.
texts.en:
Daniela is a 37-year old single mother. She has five children, but she lives with only four of them in her home, which she owns. She is an enterprising woman who helps her children advance by selling beer and soft drinks in addition to preparing food to sell in her tourist restaurant. If it were possible, she would also raise and sell ducks and hens and use them in her stews. Daniela counts on the help of her children, and because of this, her business is very profitable, since she doesn't have to pay any third-parties. Her enterprising spirit has led her to think about installing a large poultry farm so she can begin selling wholesale. Currently, she is awaiting an order of ten giunea pigs from a businessman in another city. Proudly, she says, "I raised 120 hens, from very young, and sold them for 35 Soles each. This is why I am sure that this business will greatly benefit me." .

This is the 7th time that she has taken a loan with MFP, and since she already knows the work methods of her community bank, she likes to work in an organized manner and always ensures the well-being of the rest of the members. Daniela plans to invest the money she seeks in the purchase of the supplies she needs to continue preparing foods, and serving beer, soft drinks, and some sweets.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients and soft drinks

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Bedding, bedclothes, etc., to sell

loans.name: Chap

texts.en:
Chap M., 50, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, an area known for being the most populated city in the country. 

She is a tailor and earns an income of about $2.50 per day. Her husband is employed as a commune consultant, earning an income of approximately $0.60 per day.

She is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase more products for her daughter's hairdressing business and also to help out her son's motorbike repair business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy more products to expand her daughter's hairdressing business

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
C. Nguyễn Thị (20211040037) is a 35 year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. C. is the group leader of a four member group. They are seeking a loan from SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Tiên Trà nhóm 03 (Nhóm 03).

C. is married and has three adult-aged children. To making a living, C. owns and operates a business in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from raising cattle to sell. C. has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 3.000.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, C. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. C. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3.360.000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. She is now requesting a new loan of 3.808.000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. The loan will be the third she has taken out from SEDA. C. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1. Nguyễn Thị N. (0) is a 36 year-old female who is requesting a 3.360.000 VND loan to support her business providing waste management services.

2. Trần Thị M. (0) is a 27 year-old female who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

3. Nguyễn Thị Mỵ (0) is a 45 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in the rural areas outside of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

C. Nguyễn Thị (20211040037) là 35 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. C. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Tiên Trà nhóm 03 (Nhóm 03).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán. C. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, C. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND. Vào 2008, C. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. C. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.360.000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 3.808.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1. Nguyễn Thị N. (0) là 36 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.360.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là cung cấp dịch vụ quản lý chất thải.

2. Trần Thị M. (0) là 27 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.048.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

3. Nguyễn Thị Mỵ (0) là 45 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El Sr. Francisco P. de 30 años, esta casado con el Sra. Celsa Duarte de 26 años, tienen 2 hijos uno de 9 años y otro de 7 años. 
Don Francisco se dedica a este trabajo hace más de  2 años, aproximadamente desde el año 2008; el con su esposa se fueron a la Argentina durante 3 años juntaron su dinero, luego vinieron y montaron una pequeña despensa, que va creciendo por el ingreso que genera, en la actualidad ya tiene su clientela formada, y su local se encuentra en un lugar estratégico. 
Ellos utilizaran este crédito en compra de mercaderias para su local comercial.
texts.en:
Francisco P. is 30 years old. He is married to Celsa Duarte, 26, and have two children aged 9 and 7. Francisco has been in this line of work for over two years, more or less since 2008. He moved to Argentina with his wife for three years and saved money. When they moved back they set up a modest store, which is slowly growing by generating more business. He now has an established customer base and the store is in a good location. They will use the loan to buy goods for their store.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es: La Sra. Rosa Emilia M. es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, se desempeña como maestra de educación primaria en el colegio Simeón Pereira de dicho municipio donde tiene once años de laborar. Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel con el fin de mejorar su vivienda el cual será invertido en la compra de ladrillos, cemento y zinc para la construcción de una cocina.
texts.en:
Rosa Emilia M. is a native of the municipality of El Sauce. She works as an elementary school teacher at the Simeón Pereira school in El Sauce, where she has been working for 11 years. This is the first loan that she is requesting at CEPRODEL with the objective of making housing improvements. The loan will be invested in the purchase of bricks, cement, and zinc to build a kitchen.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of brick, cement, and zinc

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 46 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Djinina, sous préfecture de Fana, région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage et font le commerce de charbon de bois, d’habillements et des articles divers.
Ces femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur treizième prêt solidaire, après avoir correctement remboursés les douze précédents.                                                                                        
FATOUMATA T. du groupe Benkadi compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des habits pour enfants et femmes.
Elle s’approvisionne le plus généralement au marché de Fana et à Bamako et effectue sa vente au village et au bord du goudron, au comptant, en gros et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 12.500FCFA qui sera utilisé dans les dépenses  quotidiennes de la famille et le reste sera réinvesti dans les activités de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Benkadi group, all married, are on average 46 years old, with 4 children, and all live in traditional families in the village of Djinina, under jurisdiction of Fana, in the region of Koulikoro (second administrative region in the Republic of Mali). They know each other through family and community links, and are all involved in selling wood, clothes and other diverse products. These women are asking for their thirteenth loan, after having reimbursed their previous loans in a timely manner. Ms. Fatoumata T. of the Benkadi group plans to use her loan to purchase clothing for children and women. She generally stocks up on products at the markets in Fana and Bamako and sells to both men and women in her village and on the side of the paved roads, asking for credit or cash. She hopes to make a profit of approximately 12,500 CFA a month (25 USD), to be spent on daily family expenses and reinvested into her business activities.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing clothes

loans.name: Hoàng

texts.en:
H. Hoàng Thị (20209010013) is a 34-year-old female living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, H. owns & operates a business raising chickens for sale.  H. has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 3,600,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  H. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,048,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. H. is now requesting a new loan of 8,288,000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be the fourth loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


H. Hoàng Thị (20209010013) là 34 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, H. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gà để bán.  H. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 7 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 3.600.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2008, H. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  H. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua thức ăn gia súc & các loại cung cấp khác.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  H. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện điều kiện sống chung của gia đình người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Sam-Ol

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam-ol T. (pictured above) is 39 years old and her husband, Mr. Samnang Chan is 45 years old. They live in a small village on National Road Number Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 1990 and have three children--two sons and one daughter. The daughter is in school; one of her sons is a garment factory worker and another one is still young and stays at home.  

Sam-ol is a rice farmer. Her husband is a soldier. She is applying for her first loan of US$ 800 to purchase a motorcycle for her son to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her son to drive to work

loans.name: Umoja Charambe Group

texts.en:
Matilda A. is in her mid-twenties and is married, with one daughter. Matilda owns a food vending business, which she has been operating for the past four years. The stall is open between 7 a.m. and 10 p.m. and earns Matilda a stable monthly profit.

This will be Matilda's fourth loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. Matilda used her previous loans to buy a piece of land and to buy saucers and pans. These loans have now been successfully repaid. Matilda's business is running smoothly, but she is unable to make any larger purchases for her apartment. Matilda is therefore seeking another loan in order to buy a television, furniture, and a radio for her home. Matilda's dream is to one day build her own house.

Matilda will share this loan with her loan group Umoja Charambe, which is made up of sixteen members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

In the picture, Matilda can be seen first on the left in the front row, wearing brown and white.

loans.use: To buy furniture and a TV deck for her home.

loans.name: Raquel's Group

texts.en:
Raquel B. is from the village of Culalabat, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 22 years old, married, and has one school-aged child. Raquel is the group leader of a 10-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

To make a living, Raquel raises livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Raquel has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP every four months.

In 2009, Raquel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Raquel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI. The previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Raquel is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. This loan will be Raquel's fourth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherpeople, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: María Esther

texts.es:
María Esther tiene 45 años D. edad, es casada y resiD. junto a su familia en el distrito pesquero D. San José, un pueblo situado cerca al mar que pertenece a la provincia D. Lambayeque y que se encuentra situado a más D. veinte minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Por más D. quince años ha trabajado vendiendo pescado fresco y salado en el mercado del distrito D. Mórrope (otro distrito D. la provincia D. Lambayeque, ubicado a una hora D. la zona en donD. resiD.). Ella adquiere su mercadería diariamente en el terminal pesquero D. la región y luego se dirige a su puesto D. trabajo a ofrecerla en venta. El negocio es una fuente importante D. ingreso y con el ayuda a su esposo a mantener la economía diaria D. su familia.

María Esther desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más pescado D. modo que sus ventas puedan aumentar y por enD., también sus ingresos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
María Esther is 45 years old.  She is married and lives together with her family in the fishing district of San José, a town near the sea which is in Lambayeque province, more than twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

For more than 15 years, María Esther has been selling fresh and salted fish in the market of Mórrope district (another district in Lambayeque province which is one hour from the area in which she lives).  She acquires her merchandise daily in the region's fishing terminal.  She then heads to her work place to offer them for sale.  Her business is an important source of income and it helps her to support her husband with the family's daily finances.

María Esther would like to expand her business by acquiring more fish so that her sales can increase and, consequently, her profits as well.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 2,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy fish to expand her sales business in the market

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Doña Santos de 47 años de Edad, vive con su esposo Horacio Lucio Romero, quien le ayuda tambien en las actividades diarias en la Comarca Santa Rita, Finca las Lajitas, Colonia La Union Nueva Guinea, donde tiene su unidad de Trabajo como es una finca de 40 manzanas, las cuales las explota sacando produccion de reices y tuberculos y tambien se dedica a la comercializacion de Ganado de donde obtiene sus ingresos y asi poder mantener su familia gozando de una buena salud y su finca en muy buen estado apta para el desarrollo ganadero.  

Está solicitando su segundo crédito, para realizar estableciento de siembra de pasto mejorado.  Su mayor sueño es aumentar su inventario Ganadero y brindarles mejoras condiciones de vida a su Familia.
texts.en:
Santos, 47, lives with her husband, Horacio Lucio Romero, who helps her with her daily chores in Santa Rita, Las Lajitas farm, in La Unión, Nueva Guinea.

She has a 40 manzana (unit of land measurement) farm there where she farms root and tubers.  She also raises cattle to earn income to support her family and keep them in good health.  Her farm is in good condition and apt for cattle raising.

She is asking for her second loan to plant improved pasturage.  Her greatest dream is to increase her herd size and provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: For pasturage planting.

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal is a housewife and the mother of four daughters and four sons. Manal's husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary; however, the salary doesn't cover house expenses and school tuition fees. Therefore, her husband, Muhammad, works in the evening as a taxi driver in the city. The second source of income helps the family live a better life. Manal came to FATEN and took out a loan to pay for car licencing fees and regular car maintenance.

Manal's husband, Muhammad, appears in the picture as Manal is a conservative woman who is not comfortable with having her picture posted on the web.

loans.use: To pay for car licencing fees and regular car maintenance

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Aneta P. is from the village of Carangan Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years of age and married to Bernardo P., a security guard. They were blessed with two children. Anita is presently engaged in buying and selling dried fish. She has been engaged in this business for ten years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In April 2006, Aneta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from PMPC. She is now requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used for additional inventory and working capital. This will be her 2nd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, and as savings for future use, especially for future business expansion.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional inventory and working capital.

loans.name: Alberta

texts.es: Alberta tiene 54 años, vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de leña, producto que compra al por mayor y después las vende de manera ambulante en las ferias comerciales de su localidad. El patio de su casa es su principal almacén de esta mercadería, ya que son numerosas rajadas de leña. Su principal ayuda que tiene es el de su hijo mayor, quien se ocupa del traslado de leña hasta que logre vender todo. Durante estos años ha visto que la venta de leña es un  negocio rentable que le ha permitido mejorar su economía, es por esta razón que su mayor deseo es tener más capital en su trabajo y tener otro puntos más de ventas. Es su quinto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de mas leña al por mayor.
texts.en:
Alberta is 54 years old and lives with her two children in her own home.  For four years she has been selling firewood which she buys wholesale and later sells at the different markets in her village.  She uses the patio of her home as the main warehouse for the wood which she keeps stockpiled.

Most of the help she receives is from her eldest son who transports the firewood until it is all sold.  Over the past few years the firewood business has been profitable and has allowed her to increase her income.  Therefore she wants to increase her working capital and establish more sales points.  

This is her fifth loan through MFP.  She is very happy for the financial support and has always been good about paying back the loans on time.  She enjoys being part of the communal bank because of how committed and supportive the members are.  She is grateful to all the lenders who are helping her to grow her business.  She plans to use the loan to buy firewood at wholesale prices.

loans.use: To buy wholesale firewood

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 37 years old, married and has three children.  She sells clothes to earn a living.  She was previously operating a retail shop.  She has managed to grow her business with the support of Faulu Kenya.  She hopes to provide quality education to her children in the future.  She dreams of expanding her business in five years.  With 20,000 Kes, she will add to her stock of clothes for resale.

loans.use: To add to her stock of clothes

loans.name: Isaías

texts.es:
El señor Isaías Márquez está muy agradecido con nosotros por la ayuda brindada al poder financiar la diferencia para adquirir su casa. Y a la vez por seguir ayudando en el mejoramiento de dicha casa.
El señor Isaías está solicitando nuevamente un préstamo esta vez para poner una losa de concreto en la casa, ya que con esta mejora desea ampliar su casa y tener mayor privacidad para su familia.
El señor Isaías y su esposa  tienen un hijo, al que desean darle un mejor patrimonio lo cual sucederá al realizarse dicha mejora.
El pagara el préstamo con los ingresos que gana de chofer de arrastre.
texts.en:
Mr. Isaías Márquez is very grateful to us for the loan we granted him to pay the difference he needed to buy his house and also for continuing to help him improve said house.

Isaías is once again requesting a loan to install concrete flooring in the house; he intends to expand and increase privacy for his family with this improvement.

Isaías and his wife have a son and they want to pass down a better estate to him which will happen once this improvement is complete.

He will repay the loan with income earned as a Hauler.

loans.use: To install concrete flooring.

loans.name: Mujeres De Nazareth Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres de Nazareth” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso.
Todas las integrantes del comité se dedican a las ventas y preparación de comidas rápidas.
La Señora  Leongina es una de las integrantes del comité, ella se dedica a la venta de ropas, de bebidas, golosinas, comestibles, etc. en su tienda general.
Ella tiene una familia muy unidad con 2 hijos y su marido, quien se dedica a la cantera (artesanía).
Leongina se encuentra muy satisfecha con su actividad y muy agradecida por las capacitaciones que recibe el grupo.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de más mercaderías para su copetín (golosinas, comestibles, bebidas, etc.) y más ropas para vender.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mujeres de Nazareth" is made of a group of several neighbors from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso.  All the members of the bank work in sales and the preparation of fast food.  Señora Leongina, one of the members of the group, sells clothing, beverages, sweets, food, etc. in her general store.  She has a very close knit family consisting of her husband, who works as a stone carver (craftsman), and their 2 children.  Leongina is very satisfied with her profession and is very grateful for the training that the group receives.  

She is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise for her snack bar (sweets, food, beverages, etc.) and more clothing to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise for her general store such as sweets, beverages and food.

loans.name: Maria Hernestina

texts.es:
María tiene 49 años de edad. Es soltera y tiene 3 hijos. Vive en casa propia en la zona rural del distrito de Reque, una zona ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Su comunidad es pequeña con un promedio de 30 familias. Actualmente, no cuenta con energía eléctrica ni agua potable.

Desde hace 15 años, se dedica a la agricultura. Cuenta con un terreno propio donde cosecha tomate y camote. También, se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales como cuyas y cerdos. Cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Es muy conocida en su zona y cuenta con una clientela ya establecida. Aprendió estas actividades de sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Desea invertir su crédito en la compra de más insumos y abono para el mantenimiento de su siembra de tomate y camote. Por ello, ha creído un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
María is 49 years old, single, and has three children. She lives in her own home in the rural section of the District of Reque, a farming area that is located twenty minutes away from the city of Chiclayo. This small community has an average of 30 families. At the moment, she does not receive electricity or potable water.

María has been farming for fifteen years. She has her own land on which she grows tomatoes and sweet potatoes. In addition, she raises and sells animals such as guinea pigs and swine. When the animals have reached the proper level of development, she offers them for sale to the merchants who visit the area where she lives. María is well-known in her area and has an established customer base. She learned these farming activities from her parents, who are known for being perfectionists in this trade.

María wants to invest in the purchase of more supplies and compost for maintaining her tomato and sweet potato crops. For this reason, she is requesting a loan in the amount of 1500 PEN.

loans.use: To purchase farming supplies to maintain her tomato and sweet potato crops.

loans.name: José Dimas Israel

texts.es: José Dimas Israel M. P. de cuarenta y cuatro años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y sus cuatro hijos en San Pedro Perulapan del departamento de Cuscatlán. El posee un molino de nixtamal en su misma casa de residencia, el cual es muy visitado por sus clientes ya que ofrece la mejor atención, el lugar es muy higiénico y les da un buen precio. José es emprendedor  y muy entregado a su trabajo, se levanta desde muy temprano pues algunas de sus clientes buscan moler el maiz con el que harán las deliciosas tortillas para el desayuno; Su molino siempre está a disposición de las personas, en el muele maiz, harinas y salsas. El desea reparlo, comprarle fajas, comprar grasa, en fin dar un mantenimiento general a toda la maquinaria; es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita realizar dichas reparaciones y otras mejoras al lugar donde esta instalado. José es un hombre de sueños que cree, en un futuro en donde su molino puede ayudarle a sus hijos, así como le ha ayudado a él, llevando el sustento al hogar y a darles una mejor vida.
texts.en:
José Dimas Israel M. P. is 44 years old and lives with his life partner and four children in San Pedro Perulapan, in Cuscatlán department.

José owns a corn mill which is located in his home.  It is very popular with his customers because he offers the best customer service, his location is very hygienic and he provides his service for a good price.  José is enterprising and very committed to his work.  He gets up very early because some of his customers want to grind the corn that they will use to make delicious tortillas for breakfast.  José's mill is always at people's disposal.  He uses it to grind corn, flour and sauces.  He would like to repair his mill and buy belts and grease in order to do some general maintenance work on the machinery.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL which will enable him to carry out these repairs and make other improvements to the place where he has his machinery installed.

José is a man with dreams.  He believes in a future when his mill will be able to help his children, as it has helped him, providing support and a better life for his household.

loans.use: to buy belts, disks and grease in order to do some general maintenance work on his machinery

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es: Herminia es integrante D. la Alcancia Comunal “Nuevo Amanecer” hace 30 anos se dedica a la agricultura  posee una chacra en donD.  siembra y cosecha Paltas y chirimoya, a sus 77 anos, es viuda. Herminia nos manifiesta que junto a su hermano tomo la decision D. adquirir una pequena chacra que actualmente le ayuda en su economia familiar. Ademas en su vivienda alquila habitaciones. Hermina ha logrado con su esfuerzo construir su casa y educar a sus hijos, actualmente cubre sus gastos D. alimentacion y D. servicios basicos. Tiene como meta en el futuro ayudar asus hijos en la formacion y educacion D. sus nietos. Herminia es una socia puntual y responsable que invertirá el crédito en la compra D. abono y fertilizantes basicos para su chacra demas D. otros y junto a los demas integrantes D. “Nuevo Amanecer” estan agradecidos por el prestamo recibido y estan comprometidos en el programa Properidad.
texts.en:
Herminia is a member of the "Nuevo Amanecer" (New Dawn) community bank.  She has been farming for 30 years and owns a farm where she grows and harvests avocados and 'chirimoyas' (custard apples).  Herminia is 77 years old and a widow.  She tells us that, together with her brother, she took the decision to buy a small farm which currently helps her financially.  Herminia also rents out rooms in her home.  She has managed, through her efforts, to build her own home and educate her children.  She currently covers her food expenses and basic service expenses.

Herminia's goal for the future is to help her children with the upbringing and education of her grandchildren.  Herminia is a punctual and responsible member of her bank and she will invest her loan in buying manure and basic fertilizers for her farm.  Both Herminia and the other members of "Nuevo Amanecer" are grateful for the loan they have received and are committed to EDAPROSPO's Prosperidad (Prosperity) program.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and manure for her farm

loans.name: Pepita

texts.en:
Pepita works very hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Pepita requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Pepita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana Francisca; ella tiene 43 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de comida, ella es propietaria de un restaurant donde prepara diferentes platos de comida en las diferentes festividades que se realiza en el distrito de Urubamba como es la fiesta del Sr de Torrechayoc que es una fiesta tradicional en el distrito de Urubamba, la socia también vende cerveza y ponches, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el servicio de restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como carne, pollo y verduras.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Juana Francisca is a member of the "San José de Urubamba" community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Juana Francisca is 43 years old, single, and has one child.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling food.  She is the owner of a restaurant where she prepares a number of different dishes.  During the different festivities that take place in Urubamba district such as the 'Sr de Torrechayoc' fiesta (a traditional fiesta in this district) she also sells beer and punch.  Through her business, Juana gets her children ahead in life.  She would like to expand and improve her restaurant service.  She is requesting this loan to buy food products to cook such as meat, chicken and vegetables.

Juana Francisca is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy food products to cook such as meat, chicken and vegetables

loans.name: Melina

texts.es:
Melina forma parte del banco comunal “El Canelo”, perteneciente a la ciudad de Linares.
Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva para adultos y niños, se dedica a éste rubro desde hace 4 años, comenzó vendiendo ropa interior, en la actualidad ha incorporado diferentes productos, por lo que su negocio ha funcionado positivamente. Compra su mercadería en la ciudad de Santiago, específicamente en los sectores de Patronato y Barrio Meiggs. Su clientela es frecuente por lo que debe renovar sus productos regularmente. 
Con el préstamo comprará pijamas de polar, jeans, chalecos, ropa interior, gorros y abrigos, específicamente para la temporada de invierno. 
Melina comenta que le va muy bien en su negocio y eso la mantiene motivada, además que disfruta mucho lo que realiza. Sus metas en su negocio son comprar un vehículo particular para trasladar su mercadería cuando la compra en la ciudad de Santiago, ya que es muy sacrificado trasladarla en buses interurbanos, debido a la cantidad de productos que compra. 
Melina es jefa de hogar y vive junto a sus 5 hijos, 3 de ellos asisten a la universidad, por lo que debe continuar en su negocio para adquirir mayores ganancias y costear los estudios superiores de sus hijos. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida del apoyo brindado por Fondo esperanza, por la facilidad de los créditos y la prioridad que le dan a los valores, principalmente la confianza, el respeto y la responsabilidad para cancelar los préstamos. 
Linares es un importante centro urbano de la región del Maule, ubicado en la zona centro del país. En esta zona se desarrolla de manera importante la producción agrícola y también vitivinícola sobresaliendo en el ámbito de las exportaciones. Destacan los cultivos de cereales (arroz, trigo, maíz y avena), hortalizas (remolacha, repollo, lechuga y acelga y legumbres) y frutas. Linares es la principal provincia productora de arroz, en Chile; de hecho, el 78% de la producción nacional de este cereal se da en esta provincia, especialmente en la comuna de Parral.
texts.en:
Melina is part of the “El Canelo” (Cinnamon Tree) Communal Bank in the city of Linares.  She sells new clothes for adults and children.  She has been in this field for four years.  She started by selling underwear.  She has currently incorporated different products, which is why her business is functioning favorably.  

She buys her merchandise in the city of Santiago, specifically in the Patronato and Barrio Meiggs sectors.  She has frequent customers, and she therefore needs to regularly restock her products.

With the loan she will buy polar fleece pajamas, jeans, vests, underwear, hats, and coats specifically for the winter season.

Melina says that her business is going very well, and it keeps her motivated.  Also, she really enjoys what she does.  Her business goals are to buy her own vehicle to transport her merchandise when she buys in the city of Santiago.  It takes a lot of sacrifice to use interurban busses for transport because of the quantity of products that she buys. 

Melina is head of the household, and she lives with her five children.  Three of them attend the university.  Therefore, she needs to continue with her business in order to get greater income and to pay for her children’s university studies.

She is very happy and grateful for the support offered by Fondo Esperanza, for the ease of securing the loans, and for the priority they give to values.  They give priority mainly to confidence, respect, and the responsibility of paying back the loans.  

Linares is an important urban center in the Maule region in the center of Chile. Agriculture is very important, and grapes for export are of increasing importance. Cereal crops (rice, wheat, maize, oats) and vegetables (beets, cabbage, lettuce, chard) and fruit grow well. Linares is the main producer of rice in Chile with 78% of national production coming from this province, especially from the community of Parral.

loans.use: to buy polar fleece pajamas, jeans, vests, underwear, hats, and coats specifically for the winter season.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
As a married parent of 5 children, Maribel works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling mud crabs in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from shrimp and fish sales. Maribel is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to purchase additional mud crabs to sell.

Maribel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional mud crabs to sell

loans.name: Mirian Del Carmen

texts.es: Mirian del Carmen D. 38 años D. edad, vive en casa propia con su compañero D. vida y sus dos hijas D. 10 y 12 años, las cuales se encuentran cursando sus primeros años D. estudio. Para Mirian su familia lo es todo y no se cansa D. luchar por darles lo mejor. Mirian posee un puesto D. tortillas en su hogar D. residencia, el cual, con gran dedicación y amabilidad atienD. día a día. La zona en donD. se encuentra ubicado es muy concurrida y D. muy fácil acceso. Mirian es una mujer emprendedora que gracias a su carisma ha sabido ganarse la confianza D. su vecindario y estos cada día la prefieren mas, ya que siempre encuentran las ricas he higiénicas tortillas cuando ellos las buscan. Mirian ha tomado la decisión D. solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en el mantenimiento D. su tortillería así como para comprar la materia prima necesaria (maíz, agua, gas propano, etc.) con el objetivo D.  dar a sus clientes el mejor servicio posible y D. esta manera poder aspirar a una mejor condición D. vida.
texts.en: Mirian del Carmen is 38 years old and she lives in her own home together with her life partner and their two daughters, aged 10 and 12. They are in their first years of schooling. For Mirian her family is everything and she does not tire in fighting to proviD. them with the best. Mirian has a tortilla stand located in her own home, which, with a great deal of dedication and kindness, she manages day after day. the region where she is located is very well traveled and access is very easy. Mirian is an enterprising woman who, thanks to her charisma, has been able to earn the trust of her neighborhood. Each day they prefer her more because they always find delicious and hygienic tortillas they look for. Mirian has maD. the decision of request a loan from Integral (Kiva Field Partner) to invest in the maintenance of her tortilla business, which is to purchase necessary ingredients (corn, water, propane gas, etc.). Her objective is to proviD. her clients with the best service possible and to aspire towards a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase corn, water, propane gas, etc.

loans.name: Dilshodi

texts.ru: Дилшод проживает в районе Бохтар. Ему 21 год. Он холост. У него среднее образование. Он живет вместе с родителями. Дилшод предоставляет услугу, такси. В основном он развозит людей по району. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже год. Кредит берет для приобретения новой легковой автомашины.
texts.en: Dilshod lives in the Bohtar district.  He is 21 years old and single.  He has a secondary education.  He lives together with his parents.  Dilshod provides a taxi service and primarily drives people within the district.  He has been involved in this business for one year.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of a new passenger car.

loans.use: to purchase a new passenger vehicle

loans.name: Dolgorsuren

texts.en: Dolgorsuren is 41 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a house in the Sansar area of Ulaanbaatar city. Her husband is a driver who owns a taxi service business. Her older two sons are students and the younger one attends secondary school. Her older son also helps with his father's taxi service business. She manages a tailoring business that she started in 2006. She started her business after her graduation from college as a designer. Her working place is located near the student dormitory. For that reason, her business is quite successful. Now she has many regular customers and is planning to expand her business in the future. She is a responsible woman who says, "Our business is operating quite successful and I like to collaborate with Xacbank because of convenient and fast services." She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to buy a new stove and to do some construction work in her house.

loans.use: To buy a new stove and construction supplies

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.es: El señor Gabriel es productor lechero; la leche la vende directamente a la empresa PIL Andina que es una fabrica industrializadora de productos lacteos; con ayuda de su familia también se dedica a al compra y venta de ganado en una feria del lugar semanalmente. El crédito lo requiere para  la compra de ganado (tanto una vaca lechera como un toro) así podrá aumentar la capacidad de producción y también ganado para la venta.  Viven en casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Laja del  departamento de La Paz; es casado y tiene tres hijos. Esta es la primera vez que su crédito es canalizado a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. Gabriel is a milk producer and sells his output directly to the PIL Andina Company, which has an industrial plant that processes dairy products. With the help of his family, he also buys and sells cattle at the fair on a weekly basis. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy cattle (one dairy cow and a bull) so that he can increase his production capacity and breed more animals to sell. Gabriel and his family live in their own home in the town of Laja in the Department of La Paz. He is married and has three children.

This is the first time that his loan has been referred to Kiva for funding.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to increase milk production and a bull for fattening and eventual resale.

loans.name: Diab

texts.en:
Diab is a 43-year-old married man living with his wife and two children. He has been working as a freelance construction worker for the past 26 years. His job consists in completing wall-foliage work. During his career, Diab was able to work closely with multiple construction projects and hired two full-time employees to help him with the work. 

His wife, who works as a housekeeper, helps him with the household expenses. Today, he is asking to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase his purchases of construction tools and supplies for a new project he is planning to do. He has a reA. need to get extra money in order to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase construction tools and supplies for a new project

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is 28 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala South region of Uganda. For the past 5 years, Annet has been working hard to manage her stationary store, which sells school supplies and electronics. 

To help expand her business, Annet has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more commodities to put in the business like exercise books and will help Annet to generate greater profits and expand her business. Annet hopes that in the future she will be able to start more side businesses. 

Annet is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Annet who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more commodities to put in the business like exercise books

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Delfina  es socia del  Banco Comunal “La Yunguyeñita”, ubicado en el distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 38  años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos.  Estudió hasta la secundaria.
La señora se dedica a la compra y venta de animales como ovinos y vacunos, a la venta de desodorantes, también se dedica a la chacra, al sembrío de papa, cebada, avena, etc.  Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace tres años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/.  800.00 nuevo soles comprará diez cajas de desodorantes, estos productos lo vende en la ciudad de Arequipa.  Trabaja sola en su negocio, su esposo se dedica a la crianza de su ganando.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es el ahorro y su ganancia.
texts.en:
Delfina is a member of the communal bank of La Yunguyeñita, located in the district and province of Yunguyo, in the department of Puno. She is 38 years old, married and has 2 children. She studied up to high school. 

She buys and sells animals such as sheep and cattle, and sells deordorant. She also works in the fields growing potatoes, barley, oats, among other things. 

She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for three years. Her first loan was 300 soles and she invested the money in her business. 

She will use the 800 soles from this new loan to buy ten boxes of deodorant to sell in the city of Arequipa. 

She works alone in her business. Her husband breeds livestock. 

What she likes about the communal bank is the savings and her profit.

loans.use: to buy ten boxes of deodorant

loans.name: Harold

texts.en: Harold is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. Harold has operated a shop for 5 years, selling clothing such as t-shirts, blouses and baby clothing. He has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy clothing and underwear stock to sell. Harold is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Harold hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy clothing and underwear stock

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely, age 43, lives in the village of Calaocan, Angadanan, Isabela, with her husband and two school-aged children. To make a living, Fely owns and operates a farming business. Her main source of income comes primarily from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Fely has been engaged in her business for over 21 years and earns approximately 36,500 PHP a month. She is also sells bananas in the local community for additional income. She needs both sources of income in order to sustain the family's daily needs and to afford to send her children to school.

She would like to request a loan in the amount of PHP 40,000 in order to purchase seeds, insecticides, and fertilizer for her farm production.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, insecticides, and fertilizer for her farm production

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 42 years old is married with four children. She lives in the Philippines. For the past six years, she has run a shop where she sells canned, goods, snacks, and beverages. Janet has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.

Janet is requesting an 11,000 PHP loan to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es: Gilberto, solicita otro crédito, porque nuevamente lo invertirá en la agricultura y comprara: cuatro sacos de abono, herbicidas y semilla para la siembra, el objetivo de él es mejorar la producción y que hayan más ingresos. Los financiamientos anteriores le han ayudado salir adelante y tener buenas cosechas, esto le permitió estar estable económicamente y poder darle lo necesario a su familia.
texts.en: Gilberto is requiring another loan because he wants to again invest in his agricultural business. He will buy: four bags of fertilizer, herbicides and seeds to plant. His goal is to improve his production and have a greater income. His previous loans have helped him to forge ahead and have good crops, which have enabled him to be economically stable and be able to provide his family with necessities.

loans.use: to buy four bags of fertilizer, herbicides and seeds.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
La señora Dolores es una persona muy trabajadora que a pesar de haber empezado muy joven a laborar y es maestra pensionada. Decidió seguir siendo productiva por lo cual empezó un negocio de venta por catalogo de cosméticos de belleza, el cual ya cuenta con muchos clientes. Solicita el préstamo para invertir en compra de mercancía para la venta navideña ya que sus clientes el están solicitando productos para dar de regalo. 
Tendrá mayor ganancia en su negocio y sus clientes estarán satisfechos por el servicio tan efectivo y rápido que les ofrecerá.
texts.en:
Dolores is a very hard-working person who started working at a very young age and is a retired teacher.  She decided to continue being productive and so started a business selling beauty products through catalogs.  She already has a lot of customers.  She is requesting this loan to invest in buying merchandise for the Christmas period as her customers are requesting products to give as gifts.

Dolores will make more profits in her business and her customers will be satisfied with the efficient and speedy service that she will offer them.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for the Christmas season

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Yrma Consuelo tiene 35 años D. edad, tiene dos hijos uno D. 9 y otro D. 19 años. Ella pertenece al grupo "La Esperanza" formado por 11 integrantes los cuales residen en el distrito D. Carabayllo.
DesD. hace año y nedio la Sra. Yrma Consuelo se dedica actualmente a la venta D. desayunos y comida. gracias a su trabajo pueD. ayudar en los pagos D. la casa y en la compra D. materiales para la construccioón D. su casa.
Una D. sus metas es poner su propio restaurant en un local propio ubicado en una muy buena zona comercial.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra D. ropa para aprovechar en vender por la campaña naviD.ña, como tiene un local lo hará ofreciendo a sus familiares, amigos y conocidos.
texts.en: Mrs. Yrma Consuelo is 35 years old and has two sons--a 9 year old and a 19 year old.  She belongs to the "La Esperanza" (Hope) Group maD. up of 11 members who resiD. in the district of Carabayllo.  For a year and a half, Yrma Consuelo has worked selling breakfasts and food.  Thanks to her work she can help with the house payments and in buying materials for building her house.  One of her goals is to have her own restaurant in her own stand in a very good commercial zone.  She will use the loan to buy clothing to take advantage of selling during the Christmas season.  Since she has a stand she will offer the clothing to relatives, friends, and acquaintances.

loans.use: buy clothing to resell

loans.name: Sothea

texts.en:
Sothea, age 36, is a soldier and his wife, Sarom, age 34, is a garment worker. They have been married since 1993 and have five daughters who are in school. The family is living in a suburb of Phnom Penh. 

Sothea is asking for a loan in the amount of $800 to buy a motorbike for his daughters to drive to school.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for his daughters to drive to school.

loans.name: Sareth's Group

texts.en:
Sareth, 46, is a married mother of four children. Two of her children work for others for fees, while the last two are still in school. Sareth started farming on her one-hectare farmland, more than five years ago, to earn a living and she supplements her income by buying and selling tamarinds. With her current business, she earns less than three U.S. dollars per day and saves one U.S. dollar per day. 

Sareth and her group member have been with VisionFund for six years. The previous loans have helped her sufficiently feed her family. Now she is requesting another loan. She will use this loan to buy tamarinds for her business. She hopes to grow her business and earn more income. She would like to set aside some money to afford a bigger house in the future. She also wishes to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy tamarinds for her business.

loans.name: Yar

texts.en:
Yar is a 32-year-old married woman with four children. All of them are in school. She has had a business selling food in a stall in Bor, South Sudan for one year.

Yar is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase onions and oil. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase onions and oil for sale.

loans.name: Banaz

texts.en:
Banaz is a 33-year-old married woman from Iraq and she is a mother of two children. For 14 years she has been helping to support her family, working from home on a sewing machine, taking great pride in her work. She happily shows her work station, which is a neat little corner in a sunlit room of her home.

In the past Banaz took a loan from Relief International - Iraq to create a work area for herself in her home, making it easier and more comfortable for her to work on her sewing and tailoring orders. After successfully repaying the previous loan, Banaz has now taken out a loan from RI-Iraq in the amount of 1800 USD, which she plans to use for purchasing a new machine, an overlock sewing machine, and some more fabric and raw materials to continue serving her customers' needs.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine and raw materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase two dairy cows.

loans.name: Barbarito

texts.en:
Barbarito B. is a farmer in the Santa Lucia County area. He owns a small plot of land where he lives with his wife, Maria, and their three children. Because he is from Santa Lucia, an area known for its rice cultivation, he has been growing rice his whole life. He also has experience with raising cows, which he owns a couple of. He hopes the loan he receives will help him in making his rice farming more efficient.

The Primero de Agosto Communal Bank in Santa Lucia

Barbarito is part of one of the newest Communal Banks in the recently developed Mifex Rural Finance Program: the Primero de Agosto Communal Bank. All bank members are part of the Association of Rice Farmers in Santa Lucia, and they will use these microloans to prepare their lands and cultivate rice on their farms. As members of a communal bank, they are all guarantors for each other's loans. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Primero de Agosto Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many microfinance programs, but Mifex believes that is imperative for the communities we work with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Below is more information about the commnity of Santa Lucia, compiled by Luis Crespo and Robert Edgar of the Mifex team when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program. Special thanks to Mario Balazantegui who provided expert insight and contributed to the development of the alliances with the local organizations.

Economy of Santa Lucia

Santa Lucia County has a population of about 33,000 people. The region is fit for rice cultivating because it is not in the lowlands and therefore it is not at risk of flooding. There is also great access to water because of the Daule River, which is accessible to many of the farmers in the area. About 70% of the farmers have basic infrastructure for watering their crops.

Rice production is the main economic activity of the area, as about 80% of the people are rice farmers. Almost everyone is either directly or indirectly involved with the rice production, as they produce, commercialize or participate in activities that add value to the product. Within the county, there is a small town also named Santa Lucia. The town is filled with many small businesses and it serves as the social and commercial hub of the area.

Rice Farming in Santa Lucia

Most of the people in the Santa Lucia area are small farmers. They produce about 100 sacks of rice per hectare of land. In order to farm they first must prepare the lands by removing weeds and plowing. The farmers then fill an area with water to form what is known as a paddy field, because rice is a very water intensive crop. The rice seeds are either dispersed freely (the process is known as boleo in Spanish) or hand sowed. Once the rice has grown, most farmers rent machinery that helps them harvest their crop. A risk factor does exist in rice farming because of drought, but in Santa Lucia this is somewhat mitigated by the access to water form the nearby river.

Access to Credit

The biggest struggle in the area has been the lack of credit. Because people do not have access to formal financial services, they have turned to loan sharks for financing. They have been affected by expensive lines of credit that exceed 100% interest a year and can be as expensive as 240%. Intermediaries also exploit the farmers because of their outstanding debt. Farmers also often lack skills and knowledge of how to commercialize their product and get fair prices for their crops.

Loan Use

The loans in this sector will be used to to buy soil, seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. They will also be used to prepare the land prior to farming, to plant the seeds and purchase other materials. The loan repayment schedule is different from the typical microentrepreneur. Because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures, Mifex asks them to repay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

loans.use: Farm rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cloth

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.en:
Genoveva I. Álfaro is a widow at the age of 57. She started her small store about four years ago at her husband's suggestion when he started to get sick. They knew that she needed a way to support herself when he was no longer able to provide for them. Now she has operated the store for four years, selling chips, noodles, sodas, dry goods, rice, beans, potatoes, and tamales.

Before she got credit from Friendship Bridge, she had to rely on her suppliers for credit, which significantly increased the cost of her goods. Now she's in her third loan cycle, and will use the credit to continue growing her inventory. Her next goal is to buy a larger refrigerator so that she can start to offer chicken and other meats for sale.

Genoveva has two grandchildren who live with her. They're too young to go to school, but they will go when the time comes, and she will help with the considerable cost of their schooling. When Genoveva was a child, she studied for only one year, but nevertheless can read and can do all the math necessary for her store in her head.

The biggest challenges that she faces are the hours that the establishment has to stay open, from early in the morning until the evening, with her minding it alone. In addition, it's always a struggle to come up with the cash to purchase the next round of inventory.

loans.use: Purchase increased inventory for store.

loans.name: Losi

texts.en:
It’s hard to keep a plantation growing when you don’t have the tools and the right supplies to assist it. Losi M. of Faleasiu is experiencing this, and for her to make it happen; she has asked for a loan amount of $300 to facilitate her plantation.

Losi's husband is a security guard and his income can not cover all the family's expenses. With any luck, borrowing this amount of money from SPBD will help Losi and her husband take better care of their plantation. This in return can provide them with good supplies for the consumers and also alow them to have a good turnover to support the family.

loans.use: Buy tools, chemicals, and weed killer

loans.name: Gulzar

texts.en: I am Gulzar B. from Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. I am the mother of eight children. My husband is old and weak and therefore does not work. My eldest son is the only bread winner of the family, and he runs an auto lubricants store. The business yields just enough to clothe and feed the family members. Our expenses are growing along with our children. My son now feels the need to expand the store by adding various automotive products to the existing product range. We are hopeful that this expansion will increase our household income substantially. Please give us a loan.

loans.use: Expand auto lubricants business

loans.name: Hashmat

texts.en: I would like to borrow $350 to help my husband diversify his business. He started keeping video games in his small grocery store last year and we made enough profit that it allowed me to save a dollar a day. We would like to keep expanding our business to stock up on more videos and also add dairy products to our grocery store. I have seven children one of whom has completed tenth grade and our house is rented. I would like to increase our income enough to see at least one or both of these things change.

loans.use: Expand grocery store

loans.name: Muhbirahon

texts.en:
Muhbirahon was born in 1975.  She is not married and lives with her parents.  She does not have a high education, but she was fond of the trade of dry ftruits after secondary school.  Her aunt is her business patner and helped her to rent her present trade place.  

From childhood, Muhbirahon was a very responsible and kind child.  When she saw how her father earned money and that it was not enough for family needs, she decided to help him.  She asked her aunt to give her part of her goods to sell.  Gradually, Muhbirahon was able to open her own trade place.  Also, her aunt was a client of Microinvest and she got Muhbirahon involved in our organization.

Today, Muhbirahon has a stable business and she repays her loans on time.  When she heard about KIVA, she wished to ask for a loan to buy an additional batch of dry fruits.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Eti

texts.en: Eti, 33, is married to D., who has no fixed job. They have three children. To support her family, she sells sheets, bedspreads, and clothing on credit, earning $100 a month. She is a member of MBK. She would like a loan of $75 to increase her inventory. She will repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To increase inventory of linens and clothing

loans.name: Mei

texts.en: Mrs. Mei S., 32, fishes for a living together with her husband. After catching fish they sell their catch in the market to earn approximately $10 a day of revenue. They have four children, one of who is a laborer with a salary of $70 a month. This couple aims to purchase a new motor for their boat and fishing equipment such as nets. This will help them catch more fish to sell in the market and increase their income.

loans.use: This couple aims to purchase a new motor for their boat and fishing equipment such as nets.

loans.name: I Wayan Badra

texts.id:
I Wayan Badra, 40 years old, is a farmer who works on his paddy field of 1.5 hectares (around 15,000 square meter). During then planting season, he was assisted by his wife and another 2 workers. He paid his worker IDR 25,000 per day for a week of planting season, so in total he spent IDR 175,000/ worker (around USD 19/ worker/ week).

During the maintenance season, he is only assisted by his wife. At the moment the paddy plants are 4 month old and they are ready to be harvested in a month time. The money from the harvest will be used to pay the fertilizer and seeds he bought last time. For the next planting season, he wants to plant a high quality paddy field so he can improve the quality of his paddy harvest and also to reduces the maintenance costs as high quality paddy plants requires less maintenance works and also less vulnerable to plaque compares to regular paddy seeds.

With the loan money, he will be able to wisely finance his next farming season to get a better harvest and enable him to repay on schedule.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

I Wayan Badra, 40 tahun, berprofesi sebagai seorang petani yang mengerjakan sawah miliknya sendiri seluas 1.5 hektar. Dengan luas lahan tersebut, I Wayan Badra mengerjakan pengolahan sawahnya dengan dibantu oleh istri dan 2 orang tenaga kerja yang dibayar Rp. 25.000.- per hari. Tenaga kerja tersebut dibutuhkan selama 1 minggu saat penanaman padi. Jadi biaya yang dikeluarkan untuk tenaga kerja selama 1 minggu adalah Rp. 175.000.- Dalam masa perawatan, I Wayan Badra hanya dibantu oleh istrinya. Saat ini umur padinya sudah 4 bulan dan sebulan lagi sudah siap dipanen. Semua hasil panen akan dipergunakan untuk membayar pupuk dan bibit yang sudah dibelinya pada masa tanam yang lalu. Saat ini I Wayan Badra merencanakan akan menanam bibit padi jenis unggul agar kwalitas beras yang dihasilkan lebih baik dan biaya perawatan bisa ditekan karena bibit padi jenis unggul lebih tahan terhadap penyakit. Dengan pinjaman yang didapatnya, I Wayan Badra akan menggunakannya dengan bijaksana agar hasil yang didapat lebih baik dan ia dapat mengembalikan pinjaman tepat waktu.

loans.use: To buy high quality of paddy seeds (Membeli bibit padi jenis unggul)

loans.name: Nilsa

texts.en:
Nilsa Rosalía T. (35) lives with her partner; the couple has a son who attends high school. Nilsa’s boyfriend works as a taxi driver, helping her to generate more income.

Ten years ago Nilsa decided to create a self-employment. Firstly she started selling fruits and vegetables in a little store in front of her house. Then Nilsa had to stop working since she had a heart problem and she needed a surgery followed by a long period of recovery. Consequently, she closed the store. Despite these hard times and her unhealthy situation, Nilsa never gave up. And when her condition improved she opened the grocery store and continued working with full energy. Today, she offers a wide variety of products to large numbers of customers. The grocery store is located in a neighborhood where the government established many homeless families who had nowhere to go.

It is worth mentioning that Nilsa is studying at nursing school. Nilsa’s biggest dream is to finish school and become a nurse in order to help her community.

She needs this loan to increase the number of sales at her grocery store. The products she will buy with the loan are sugar, rice, pasta, breads, drinks, candies, and cleaning products among others.

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, rice, pasta, breads, drinks, candies, and cleaning products among others.

loans.name: Soeng

texts.en:
Mrs. Soeng M., 36, and her husband, Mr. Sim Sorn, 35, who live about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1994 and have four children, three sons and one daughter. Their daughter works in a garment factory, and their oldest son grows rice, while the other two are in school.

Mrs. Soeng has been growing rice since 1994 and started to raise pigs early this year, while Mr. Sim has been a motor remoque (a motorbike with a trailer at the back) taxi driver since 2000. Besides operating the taxi, he also grows rice. Now Soeng is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase feed for pigs and buy extra six piglets.

loans.use: To purchase feed for pigs and buy six piglets.

loans.name: Sithon

texts.en:
Mrs. Sithon K., 35, and her husband, Mr. Chea Sok, 38, live on an Island of the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, and have been married for over ten years. They have three children: one son and two daughters. One of their children is in a local school.

Mrs. Sithon has been a silk weaver since she was twenty years old, a skill she learned from her mother, while Mr. Chea has been a silk weaver since he was married. He learned his skill from his wife. The couple sells their finished products to a middle man in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh.

Sithon is requesting a loan of US$200 to purchase silk material for her husband’s loom.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr:
Aissatou B., is 43 years old, is married and has 5 children of whom she takes care. She has been a member of the Tenghory Transgambienne bank for the past 4 years. She would like to get a loan so that she can buy and sell honey, palm oil and lemon. The income gained from this will help her improve her living conditions and health. This loan will be reimbursed in six months in one installement.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Translator

Aissatou B., 43 ans, mariée avec 05 enfants en charge est membre du banc Tenghory Transgambienne depuis 4 ans. Elle veut un prêt pour acheter et revendre du miel, de l’huile de palme et du citron. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer ses conditions de vie et de santé.Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Purchase and resale of honey, palm oil and lemon.

loans.name: Mwanamkuu's Nia Njema Group

texts.en:
Mwanamkuu is 30 years old. She is married with 3 children, ages 2, 4, and 3. She also takes care of 2 other children, ages 6 and 8. She became a food seller in 2004. Every day she works from 8:00 AM to 6:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Mwanamkuu now requests a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Time, who also has her own shop.

loans.use: To buy more food items to increase her stock

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris F. sells provisions, drinks, and kitchen utensils in her shop, and she has been in this business for a long time. Doris is 41 years old and married with 3 children who are all attending school.

Doris does not have a kiosk, so she sells her provisions, drinks, and kitchen utensils in an open area. She needs a loan to build a kiosk where she can stock her goods and sell to her customers. Building a kiosk will allow her to store her goods securely overnight so that she doesn't have to pack her goods each night and take them home. Doris lives at Issashi, Lagos state, Nigeria. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To build a kiosk where she will sell her goods

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Abdul L. A., a 35-year-old dealer in mobile phones and accessories, is single with one child who is currently in school. Also a provider of repairs and servicing for his customers, Abdul says that the sale of mobile phones has become a very lucrative business in Ghana because almost every Ghanaian desires one for easy and fast communication.

Since he buys his supplies from importers at wholesale prices, he is requesting a loan to procure an increased stock of phones and accessories. With the resulting additional profits, Abdul hopes to expand his shop to include the sale of computers and computer parts.

Abdul belongs to the group called “Saamu” (Receiving) Trust Group. In this group, members agree to guarantee each other’s loans.

loans.use: To procure an increased stock of mobile phones and accessories.

loans.name: Sandra Marina

texts.es:
La señora Sandra Marina S. C. tiene la edad de 40 años, su estado civil es soltera, doña Sandra tiene 1 hija de 15 años que cursa recientemente el 2 año de secundaria sus propósitos son de mejorar su negocio y adquirir mas conocimiento en lo que seria el mercado competitivo por lo que en sus deseos  esta el que su hija logre graduarse y seguirla ayudando para que pueda tener un futuro prometedor en sus estudios.
