Su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos como lo es perfumes, cremas, lociones y pintura de labio el tiempo que tiene de tener este negocio es de 2 años, ella  inicia este negocio por medio de una señora que la indujo que a través de la venta de este obtendría ingresos para su familia pero comienza con la venta de perfumes para varón por lo que al ver que obtiene resultados de este negocio decide realizar un financiamiento que estaría destinado para el capital de trabajo por lo que necesita realizar las compras de mas productos por lo que también se avecinan las fechas festivas y necesita demostrar la variedad de sus productos.
texts.en:
Ms. Sandra Marina S. C. is a 40-year-old single mother with a 15-year-old daughter who is in her second year of high school. She plans on improving her business and acquiring more knowledge with respect to the competitive market. She also hopes that her daughter will manage to graduate, and that she can keep supporting her so that she can have a promising future in her studies.

Her business consists of selling cosmetics, such as perfume, creams, lotions, and lipsticks. She has had this business for 2 years. She started the business because a woman persuaded her to do so, telling her that she would be able to obtain an income for her family through cosmetics sales. She started out by selling cologne for men. Upon realizing that the business yielded favorable results, she decided to take out a loan, which she will use as work capital to purchase more products. Furthermore, the holidays are approaching, so she needs to offer a variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Nakabugo A –Nalongo Group

texts.en:
Tamale N., age 46, breeds poultry and livestock. She has been in this business for 18 years. Her farm is located in her own compound, and includes local breeds of cattle, goats, pigs and broilers (chickens). N. is an enlightened businesswoman who has kept her business running by keeping proper stocks and account records. From the sale of 100 broilers, she earns a profit of approximately UGX 80,000. N. is using the loan to purchase more broilers to meet her customers' demands.She hopes to expand her business by bringing in a variety of breeds like freshians, broilers and layers. 

She also operates a brick-making project in her home, from which she has created employment for four men as brick-makers. She is married and has 9 children between the ages of 7 and 26. Her dream is to see all her children go through life successfully.

loans.use: Purchase more broilers

loans.name: Adalet

texts.en: Adalet Z. owns a little shop where he sells food products such as sugar, candies, and tea. He started his business in 1995, using his savings to purchase his first batch of sugar, salt, and tea products. The business was successful and he soon diversified his offerings with candies and macaroni. Today, his shop is well known in the food market. He is a very cheerful person, and he is always glad to meet anyone who comes into his shop. All his clients are satisfied with his service. Adalet wants to make his assortment of food products more competitive. In the near future, he dreams of expanding his business and buying other food goods such as milk, soft drinks, rice, and so on. He is requesting US $1,200. This loan will be an important part of the growth of Adalet’s business.

loans.use: To purchase food products as soft drinks and rice to increase profit

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Isabel Ramírez Cayo vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Pasankeri, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposo, el señor Francisco Quispe y su hijo.
La señora Isabel es cocinera, vendiendo almuerzos en un puesto ambulante de su zona, y su esposo trabaja  como chofer de transporte publico.
Con créditos anteriores construyeron dos habitaciones en obra gruesa, las mismas que aun no pueden ser habitadas.
El crédito es para la conclusión de la construcción en obra fina de las dos habitaciones (las paredes y los tumbados deben ser revocados con estuco y luego recién pueden ser pintados, las conexiones eléctricas deben ser finalizadas, etc.,).
Esta es la octava vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Isabel Ramírez Cayo lives in the Pasankeri zone on the western side of the city of La Paz. She lives in her own home with her husband Francisco Quispe and their son. Isabel is a cook, and works as a street hawker selling meals in her neighbourhood. Her husband works as a public transport driver. With previous loans they completed the basic construction of two rooms, however they are not yet inhabitable. This loan is to completely finish the construction of the rooms: the walls and ceiling need to be covered in stucco and then painted, the electrical wiring needs to be completed etc. This is the eighth time she has sought a loan, and the socioeconomic analysis classified her favourably as eligible for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials, stucco, paint, electrical connections etc. to finish two rooms in her home

loans.name: Naseem Fatima Maqbool Ahmad Ayazi Group

texts.en:
Naseem Fatima baji is a 55-year-old married woman and a citizen of Borewala, Pakistan for the past 26 years. She is married to a man whose name is M. A. A., and he is a property dealer. Naseem baji is the mother of four children: one son and three daughters. Her son runs a barber shop. Her daughters are getting an education from a local school which is located near her house. Naseem baji is an older lady so she mostly spends her time on household work. She successfully repaid two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy materials (mirror, chairs, and razors and creams) for her son’s barber shop. 

She is the group leader of more women in her area. Khursheed akhtar baji would like a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Sajida baji would like a loan to buy animals (goats) for her animal selling business. Naziran baji would like a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy materials for a barber shop

loans.name: Betania 1A Group

texts.en:
Apner N. is forty-two years old. He leads a group of 10 people, which is called Betania 1a Group. He lives in Nekmese - Naet, Kupang District, East Nusa Tenggara Province in Indonesia. The income source of the community in Nekmese Naet village is the agricultural sector. To earn money, Apner usually sells bananas, cucumbers, vegetables, cassavas, corns and coconuts in the traditional market as well as the markets in Kupang City, but he feels that the income that he earns is not enough to meet his family needs. Apner is a married man and has 4 children who are: Ricki N. 15 years old - in Junior High School Grade 3; Frengki N. 13 years old - in Elementary School Grade 6; Nonci N. 11 years old who has suffered from deafness since she was born. Apner can not send her to school because there is no school for deaf people in this village. And the last one is Reni N. 5 years old – who studies in the Kindergarten.

As a farmer, Apner wants to improve his income by running another business. He is interested in the cattle fattening program because it can generate a large profit. Apner is requesting Rp. 3,300,000 to buy cattle to be fattened. The same as Apner, the other group members are also requesting loans from TLM to buy cattle to be fattened over the 12 month period. They will repay the initial cost of the cattle and get the profit after selling the cattle. 

Note: The group picture was taken separately because 4 members of this group are involved in building the church in their village. Yurita also wasn't present when the group picture was taken, so her husband replaced her in the group picture.

loans.use: To buy cattle to be fattened

loans.name: Muibat

texts.en: Muibat A. is 50 years old and married with 4 children. She sells provisions like noodles, milk, etc. She is requesting the loan amount of N 50,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Hermila

texts.es:
Comenzo con la venta de delineador para ojos, pero la gente empezo a pedir mas variedad, como perfumes, comenzo con amigos, vecinos y ahora quiere comenzar con los perfumes de este catalogo jafra.

Ella es un gran apoyo para su esposo, ya que con los ingresos que gana, mantienen a sus tres hijos de 10, 9  y 6 años, que como padres les brindan el estudios y cubren sus necesidades.

ahora comenzara con este producto que se lo han solicitado mucho, apoyemos esta gran emprendedora.
texts.en:
Doña Hermila started selling eyeliner, but people started to demand more variety, such as perfumes. She started with friends, neighbours, and now she wants to begin selling perfumes from the Jafra Catalog.

She represents an important support for her husband, as the income is to maintain their three children, 10, 9, and 6 years of age. As parents they give them schooling and cover their needs.

Let us support this great entrepreneur as she is starting to sell this new highly demanded product.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy goods

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es socia del Banco Comunal Empecemos.
Isabel es casada, tiene 56 años y 4 hijos, Isabel tiene una imprenta llamada SEGMI, en donde brinda servicios diversos como impresión, elaboración de tarjetas, su local es alquilado y esta ubicado en el centro de la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de sus hijos.
Isabel necesita un préstamo de 2600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de andamios y toner.
Los sueños de Isabel son que sus hijos culminen sus estudios en la universidad e implementar su imprenta con maquinas modernas.
texts.en:
Isabel is a member of the community bank “Empecemos” (“We begin”). Isabel is married. She is 56 years old and has 4 children. Isabel has a printing press called SEGMI, from which she provides various services like printing and card making. Her business location is rented, and is located in the center of the city Ayacucho. It is an activity that she does with the help of her children. Isabel needs a loan of 2600 soles, money that she would invest in the purchase of framework and toner. Isabel’s dreams are that her children finish their studies in university and that she can implement modern machines in her printing press.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy toner

loans.name: Ketty

texts.en: For the last five years, Ketty has made a living selling fish in the Kola neighborhood of Morogoro. She is a member of the Waridi Loan Group, and makes about $175 a month by working at her business for 12 hours a day.  Ketty is applying for her first loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more fish to resell, and hopes that this loan will allow her to increase her profits and expand her business.  Ketty is 50 years old, single, and has one child, who is 32 years old. She is also responsible for the care of one dependent.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell and expand her business.

loans.name: Barbara's Group

texts.en: B. Barbara is a hardworking and friendly lady with a strong drive succeed in business and to live the best life with her family. Barbara is a married woman with a poultry business that she has owned for 5 years, keeping both broilers and layers near her home. As a result of her hard work and actively saving, she has been able to buy cows that also provide her with milk to sell, hence increasing her daily income. She sells the eggs to her customers in Kayunga and Jinja and, like the broilers, for meat. She is also a farmer, but on a smaller scale. She hopes to increase this aspect once she finds a much bigger chunk of land for agriculture. Barbara needs a loan to help with buying more chicken feed for her birds.

loans.use: Buying more chicken feed for poultry business.

loans.name: Ajebaye

texts.en: K. lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells plantains. K. has been in this business for the past 10 years. She is 35 years old and married, and she has 6 children. She is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more plantains to sell. She thanks you

loans.use: To purchase more plantains to sell

loans.name: Zaujati

texts.en:
Zaujati is a member of the Bondeni borrower group in Ilala, Iringa. She is a 32-year-old woman, married, and the mother of 3 children. Her children are ages 9, 6, and 3.

Zaujati started her own charcoal and clothes business 10 years ago. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 100,000 Tanzania Schillings.

This is Zaujati’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more charcoal. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Zaujati hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 28 years old. He is married and the father of one child. His child is still breastfeeding. Richie, as he is popularly called, is very hard working and dedicated to his business. For him to be in focus and stable, he has had to shun unnecessary things that were retarding both his family and business growth.

He deals in video and movie discs, a business he has done for three years now. He buys stock from Nigeria and spends almost a week or two before he returns to Ghana. He dreams of expanding his business by renting a store so that he can stock his shop to attract customers. He would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy video discs, African movies, foreign movies in bulk and used clothing, etc.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is a member of the Dodoma Road borrower group in Kihesa,Iringa,she is 24 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 1 child,Her child is aged 2 years.

Christina started her own business selling charcoal 6 years ago,she works 8 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 170,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Christina`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more charcoal for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Christina hopes to save Money,and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for sale

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: La señora Maria Teresa V. de 39 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos y cosméticos, negocio que inicio hace catorce años con dinero propio y luego con prestamos que Afodenic presto lo cual ha incrementado su inventario como las ventas lo cual es de mucha ganancia para sus gastos cotidiano y para cubrir las necesidades de su familia, su esposo es músico andino, tiene dos hijos uno de 3 y 17 años de edad, el mayor estudia la secundaria, y con esta crédito es su sexto ciclo que invertirá en comprar ropa variada, zapatos y cosmético, vende al contado y al crédito de quincena y espera elevar las ventas con este financiamiento, agradecida con la institución por la oportunidad de los préstamo para aumentar su inventario.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Teresa V. is 39 years old and is in the business of selling clothes, shoes and cosmetics. She started this business 14 years ago with her own money and later took advantage of loans from AFODENIC to increase her inventory and therefore also her sales. This business contributes a lot to help pay for daily expenses and the needs of her family. Maria's husband is a musician who plays traditional Andean music, and they have two children, a 3-year-old and a 17-year-old who attends secondary school. This loan would be the sixth that she has invested in the purchase of various articles of clothing, shoes and cosmetics. Maria sells her items for cash, and also offers a 2-week long financing option. With this loan, she hopes to increase her sales. Maria is very grateful for the opportunity this institution as given her to increase her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing and cosmetics for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat des boissons alcoolisées

loans.name: Mawuesso

texts.fr: Cette femme est mariée et mère d’un enfant, elle exerce comme activité la vente de produits pharmaceutiques, cela lui permet de d’aider son époux dans les charges du foyer. Elle s’approvisionne à lomé. Une partie de son stock étant épuisée, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 40 seringues, 30 perfuseurs, 100 élastiques.
texts.en:
This is a married woman who is the mother of one child. She has a business selling pharmaceutical products. This enables her to help her husband with expenses at home. She stocks up in Lomé. A portion of her stock being exhausted, she’s requesting a WAGES loan for buying 40 syringes, 30 perfusers, and 100 elastic bands.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pharmaceuticals

loans.name: Muma

texts.en:
W. is a widow with three children. She lives in Foncha St, Nkwen, Cameroon. W. and her entire family are living in a house with two rooms. W. has had to overcome some challenges in life, such as ill health, facing difficulties to pay her children's school fees and the death of her husband. She does knitting and farming for a living.

This will be W.'s second time to receive a loan from GHAPE. She has been a member since 2008. She has been quite successful in the past with her business due to the location of her business and her reasonable prices.  Also with experience, she is now seeing good profits from her business. Part of her profits from this loan will be used to take care of her children, buy necessities for the family and give them good medication whenever they are sick and to buy some kitchen equipment.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its client

loans.use: To buy seeds and clear farmland; also to buy thread for knitting

loans.name: Everlyn

texts.en:
Everlyn T. is from the village of Mison, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 28 years old. Everlyn is married and has 3 infants. Everlyn's main source of income comes from operating a clothing business. Everlyn has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Everlyn joined GDMPC in order to gain access to financial services that could help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Everlyn is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase more ready made clothing for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Everlyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchasing more ready made clothing for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bulk supplies to sell.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie L. is from the village of Balanlinao, Plaridel Mis. Occ. She is 36 years old. Tessie is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Tessie owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for her business comes primarily from selling vegetable such as squash, sayote, cabbage, and other vegetables in the local community. Tessie has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Tessie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tessie is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Tessie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es: Santiago C. G. de 41 años de edad, reside en San Francisco Goteras, ubicado en el departamento de Morazán. Vive junto a su esposa, y sus tres hijos todos menores de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Santiago, es un hombre muy trabajador el cual vela por el bienestar de su familia, es por ello que se dedica a varios negocios como la compra y venta de ganado, vende maíz y así mismo posee una tienda de productos perecederos, negocio el cual esta ubicado en su casa y recibe la ayuda de su esposa. Todo esto lo hace con el fin de poder obtener mayores ganancias. Santiago solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir su tienda, de manera que pueda tener mayor clientela quienes prefieran su negocio. Él es una persona que se destaca por ser muy trabajadora el cual siempre esta buscando una alternativa más para poder obtener mayores ganancias y así brindarle una mejor vida a su esposa e hijos.
texts.en:
Santiago C. G., 41 years old, lives in San Francisco Goteras, located in the Morazán department. He lives with his wife and his three children, all underage, who are studying. Santiago is a very hardworking man who looks after the well being of his family. This is why he works in various businesses such as trading cattle, selling corn, and he also owns a general store. This business is located in his home and his wife helps him with it. He does all this so as to obtain a better income.

Santiago asks for a loan with which he can stock up his store, thus attracting a bigger clientele and earning their patronage. He stands out as a very hard working person who is always looking for a new way to obtain a bigger income and thus offer his wife and children a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inventory

location.town: San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio A. is from the village of Hasan, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. He is 24 years old. Antonio is married and has three infant children. To make a living, Antonio owns & operates a business providing motorcycle (habal-habal) services to the local community. Antonio has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Antonio joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Antonio is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used additional capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Antonio from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the needs of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As additional capital

loans.name: Pedro Joaquín

texts.es:
La señor Pedro Joaquín E. E.  es originaria del municipio de condega el va usar el crédito para comprar lo útiles  escolares  y matricula de sus hijos solicita el crédito porque no tiene todo el dinero para  hacerlo actualmente  y desea matricular a sus hijos sin que ellos tengan ninguna dificultad al empezar el año escolar también tomara parte del dinero para que su esposa  trabaje en su negocio como lo es venta de granos básicos su esposa trabaja con su papa en una camioneta.   

Pedro es trabajador de la universidad agropecuaria del trópico seco ucatse desempeñándose como guarda de seguridad tiene mas de 6 años de estar trabajando para la universidad y toda la vida se a dedicado a este tipo de trabajo el espera que el crédito le sirva de mucho ya que resolverá sus problemas persónales.
 
Pedro es casado   y tiene cuatro hijos en edad escolar los cuatro están bajo su cargo estudiando actualmente  en el nivel de primaria sus padres no viven con el pero  se mantiene al pendiente de ellos  este es el primer crédito que se le otorga a Pedro y expresa que quedara agradecido con ceprodel por la ayuda que se le esta brindando ya que le ayudara a solucionar los problemas  que tiene por ahora y expresa que es la primera ves que el contrae una deuda y espera salir bien para seguir trabajando y no manchar su record crediticio y de esta manera dejar una buena imagen con ceprodel para que en un futuro se le siga atendiendo de igual forma.
texts.en:
Pedro Joaquín E. E. is from the Condega municipality. He will use the loan to buy school supplies and to enroll his children. He is asking for the loan because he does not have all the money to do so now. He wants to enroll his children so that they do not have any difficulty starting the school year. He will also take part of the money so that his wife can work in her business selling basic grains. His wife works selling potatoes in a van. Pedro is a workman for the Catholic Agricultural University of Trópico Seco (UCATSE). He has worked as a security guard for the university for over six years. He has done this type of work all of his life. He expects that the loan will be of much use; it will resolve his personal problems. Pedro is married and has four school-age children in his care. They go to school and are currently in the primary grades. His parents do not live with him, but he continues to look after them. This is Pedro’s first loan. He says that he will remain grateful to Ceprodel for the help they are offering him. It will help him solve the problems he now has. It is the first time that he has contracted a debt, and he expects to do well in order to keep working and not mar his credit record. That way he will make a good impression with Ceprodel, and they will continue taking care of him in the same manner in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for pre-registration, registration, and school supplies for his children

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan S., age 30, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia.  She sells groceries at home in her province, earning approximately $3 per day.  By doing so, she is able to cover her family expenses.  She has been with this business since 2000. 

Her husband helps his wife in the business and earns the same amount of income. Chan wants a loan to expand her business and is requesting $1200 to purchase motorbikes for resale to make a profit. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: Buy motorbikes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy and sell onions and salt

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mrs. Mao S. is 32 years old and lives in Thum village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Voeun Hong, are mushroom farmers who own a plot of land for growing crops to earn a living for their family. They do not have enough money to support their farming. Thus, Mrs. Mao S. decided to ask for a loan to buy mushroom spores and other supplies to support her mushroom farming. With this loan she hopes to increase income to improve her family's living standards. This couple has three children, one of whom is supporting their business while the other two attend the local school. Her husband is on the right of the picture.

loans.use: To buy mushroom spores and other supplies

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca, 43 years old and a mother of four, has been operating a retail shop and a boutique for the past five years to earn a living.  She also runs a butchery to earn extra income.  Previously employed before she went into business, Francisca hopes to grow her enterprise and improve her living standards in the future.  She is now requesting a loan of Kes 50,000 from Faulu Kenya to add stocks of sugar, wheat flour and clothes to sell in her boutique.

loans.use: To buy sugar, wheat flour and clothes for sale in her boutique
